lenormand-01.png.description: Something is coming your way, and you better be prepared! When The Rider appears in your lenormand reading, it usually means that the delays that might have fettered you before are going to be released. A rapid burst of activity is about to occur, leaving you filled with passionate energy. You might find that your day is hectic and action packed. This card may come in the form of either a person, a message, or an event. While the general feeling behind this card is positive, it also usually means that what comes your way is not something that will stick - permanency is not the Riderâ€™s strong suit. Consider this card a fleeting opportunity that needs your swift action to benefit.
lenormand-01.png.title: The Rider

lenormand-02.png.description: To find the Clover in a Lenormand reading (and in real life) is usually a sign of a happy coincidence of some sort. It is associated with luck and opportunities, though ones that are not too significant in nature. We associate the Clover card with lifeâ€™s small joys - which are usually fleeting, passing by at a momentâ€™s notice. Therefore, the Clover is also indicative of something that we must take quick action to reap the benefits of. Youâ€™ve only got a short window to make use of this chance! This card also lends a feeling of lightheartedness and humor to any situation. When things in life are fleeting and ever-changing, whether the situations are positive and negative, we can learn to not take them too seriously. Remembering that all things pass can help us lighten up, but perhaps may also make us take our responsibilities too lightly. Youâ€™ll have to look to the remainder of all  your cards in order to interpret this with some accuracy.
lenormand-02.png.title: The Clover

lenormand-03.png.description: At the heart of the Ship card is the concept of travel, of journeys and all that one experiences during it. It can very well mean taking a trip of some kind to a far off place, but it can also signify the mental state of travel - the desire to see new places, to explore and to voyage into the unknown. Regardless of whether you are actually, physically making a journey, this card signals heading out on an adventure of some sort - where you are going far from what is familiar. This card can also imply distance to its surrounding cards, sometimes concerning long-distance relationships, far away family, or an overseas business trip - depending on your question and the other cards in the spread. This definition too, can also be more metaphorical in nature. While you may be in close proximity physically to something, you may not feel close to it. Finally this card can also signal the choice to move away from something. While journeys can be taken in the search for new, unexplored realms, there are times too when we must undertake a journey in order to leave something else behind.
lenormand-03.png.title: The Ship

lenormand-04.png.description: When the House appears in oneâ€™s Lenormand card reading, issues of family and home life are being referenced. It can signal both the physical space, the people within it - such as specific family members, and also the more abstract concept of home. When we think of places that feel like home, they are places where we feel safe, where we feel protected, where we feel like we belong, where we are comfortable. This same sense of belonging and comfort, while creating stability and security - can also make it difficult to go forth and try new ways of doing things. The house is a boundary between what is outside and what is inside - it is a bubble or a barrier, something which separates. It implies that there is an â€œusâ€ and a â€œthemâ€. This can mean keeping things away from the private eye, but also can translate to the feeling of close-mindedness.
lenormand-04.png.title: The House

lenormand-05.png.description: This card can comment on a variety of things - though in more general situations, it focuses on wellbeing and health - both in a physical and a spiritual sense. The tree asks us to look at ourselves from a holistic perspective. Perhaps it is an indication to take a walk with nature. Our roots lie far back in our pasts, so timing wise, it tends to refer to past events and situations - a current moment grounded in what came before. Like a tree, what is happening today perhaps took quite a bit of time to grow - but what came out of that time created security. With its many intertwining branches, it also reminds us that we are all connected - and thus the card can also indicate there is a deep bond between two people in a reading.
lenormand-05.png.title: The Tree

lenormand-06.png.description: As a metaphor, when clouds are blocking out the sun, we are unable to see the light of truth. A cloud can act as a veil that obscures something; an in a Lenormand reading, the Cloud stands for that which is hidden, and the doubts and confusion caused by lack of clarity. You might be finding yourself in a moment where you are unsure of what choices you can take, or where you can go. Because you have so little guidelines, you might be feeling lost. The clouds themselves too, are vapor - never necessarily having a tangible shape; itâ€™s another sense in which clouds in a Lenormand reading can indicate how vagueness creates more misunderstandings.
lenormand-06.png.title: Clouds

lenormand-07.png.description: As one of humanityâ€™s most ancient symbols, seeing the Snake in your Lenormand reading can reflect many aspects and faces of this animal. Desire and craving, or ambition is one of these facets, especially a desire of the sort that very strong, almost consuming. Some of these desires can be harmless, and others, when uncontrolled, can lead to a kind of addiction. There is also the sense that the kind of desire that is represented by the snake is so strong, that incredible determination comes alongside it - sometimes making for an almost single-minded focus. Another facet of the snake can involve deception - to be specific, the kind of deception that is calculating and self serving, almost manipulative.  Another interpretation of the Snake card in Lenormand that is rarely used, but just as important, is its wisdom and knowledge. While in more traditional interpretations, such as the ones above, it has been plastered with morality, there is a more pure reading of the snake that has none of those value judgements. In other cultures, their intelligence is revered, and sacred, and even in western interpretations, we must remember that it was the snake that brought us truth - though, forbidden truth.
lenormand-07.png.title: The Snake

lenormand-08.png.description: The Coffin Lenormand card speaks about loss and all its related hardships - it is about the emotional process and transitions we have to make when something which we hold dear ceases to exist. This Lenormand card indicates that you are going through an ending, and youâ€™ll have to look towards the other cards within the reading to understand what this ending is about; perhaps a state of mind, a relationship, a job, or a deeply held belief. Alongside loss, comes suffering, and the coffin card can also indicate grief and mourning - a stage that we must go through in order to let something that weâ€™ve lost go. Sometimes, the card can indicate that your  progress is stalled because you cannot let go, and properly mourn and release a deep seated pain. Finally, this card can also indicate burying - we are putting something so deep in the ground that we can never access it again. This card can indicate that you are repressing something; it could be feelings, wishes, desires, fears - things that perhaps you may feel deep shame or guilt about.
lenormand-08.png.title: The Coffin

lenormand-09.png.description: Joyful and light social interactions are represented by the Bouquet Lenormand card. This card indicates that we are being presented with some of lifeâ€™s more pleasant occasions, and we should be taking some time to enjoy them. This card indicates that this is a good chance to develop friendships, reach out, and take pleasure in the kind of happiness that others can bring. The Bouquet can also be an expression of gratitude and appreciation - it is a token of thanks and recognition that we give to those who support us. This token can be both from sincere feelings, or out of social politeness, or sometimes flattery with a hidden ulterior motive. It is up to the reader and the surrounding cards to determine which face of the Bouquet is present.
lenormand-09.png.title: The Bouquet

lenormand-10.png.description: Youâ€™ll have to be on the lookout for something when you see the Scythe card appear in a Lenormand reading. A sudden ending is on the horizon, and it will most likely come without warning or expectation - though we must remember that all endings are not necessarily harmful ones. The ending will most likely be swift, and signal a clear break - and what occurs can also lead to lasting effects. On a more symbolic level, the Scythe represents harvesting - a time when we are reaping the rewards (or punishments) of our past actions. It can mean a moment of taking stock of what we have accomplished, of self-judgement and reckoning. We must look backward to understand what we can best do to move forward and learn from what has been completed. Therefore, the Scythe can also signal a closure in that sense.
lenormand-10.png.title: The Scythe

lenormand-11.png.description: The Whip Lenormand card is an indicator of conflict, of arguments and aggression. As a symbol, it has a long history of being used as a form of punishment and abuse. Usually, this card will indicate some kind of verbal disagreement - when two different modes of thinking collide. During more heated episodes, arguments can turn personal, meaning that this card can also stand for insults and personal attacks. In rare instances, the Whip Lenormand card can also stand for abuse of a physical kind too. The Whip Lenormand card can also stand for any kind of destructive behavior that is fueled by negativity - sometimes the card exists to show that the motivations behind actions are to simply cause another person pain. This card can be a stand in for the suffering that we receive from others. Taking it a step further, when one undergoes the suffering for so long, we can internalize the messages of the Whip card - it can become a form of self-punishment. We can carry with us deep feelings of shame and guilt, that leads us to a cycle of self-hatred.
lenormand-11.png.title: The Whip

lenormand-12.png.description: A lot of activity and energy is indicated when seeing Birds in your lenormand reading. Thereâ€™s a strong sense of restlessness, of flitting about from one place to another, of manifold excitement that happens when these little animals gather together. Birds can be hyper alert, filled with nervous anxiety that makes it difficult for them to stay in one place for too long. This card can also be indicative of chatter happening in your life - and sometimes even gossip. When many birds gather, there seems to be an excited exchange of songs - building up to a constant stream of noise. Another meaning of this card can include being distracted by many things - your consciousness is focused on too many ideas, making it difficult for you to focus.
lenormand-12.png.title: Birds

lenormand-13.png.description: Though the Child Lenormand card can reference an actual child, it is sometimes more helpful to see it in a reading as an indication of a fresh start, or something that is new in oneâ€™s life. It can take the form of a new relationship, a new job, or a new way of thinking. To understand exactly what the card is referencing, you'll have to look at the surrounding cards to find out. Alongside this meaning, the Child Lenormand card also comes with the traits of innocence and naivete, as well as inexperience. Because you are going through a new process, you may tend to be more trusting and open, meaning you may be more vulnerable. You may make mistakes more often than others who have gone through this before. You may also be more playful and curious than others, meaning your innocence may bring a fresh approach and open up new perspectives where others may have overlooked.
lenormand-13.png.title: The Child

lenormand-14.png.description: A cunning trickster, the fox has been traditionally known to farmers as a thief that steals their hard earned crop. For that reason, some of the more common meanings to the fox include deception by a cunning and shrewd creature. But we can also understand the fox as a creature that engages in that kind of behavior in order to adapt and survive. Sometimes, in order to make ends meet, we have to engage in egotistical and selfish behavior. Self-care is sometimes interpreted by others as selfishness. The methods they use may certainly not be honest or fair, but those may be the only means available to them. The intelligence of the Fox can also translate to not just sneaky behavior, but also suspicion and distrust. They tread lightly on their environments, aware of all the danger that may be lurking. This too, is a survival instinct.
lenormand-14.png.title: The Fox

lenormand-15.png.description: Power and strength are represented by the Bear in Lenormand; and this power can manifest in many forms. It can be physical size, their position in society or work (such as a manager), their role in the family (like a parent), or even their personality (a dominating, bossy person). The power that Bear Lenormand card wields can either be used for positive reasons, such as when a mother bear is protective of her cubs, or for selfish reasons. In the best of light, the bear can represent a leader, one that both nurtures and teaches, guiding those in their care towards a better future. In this case, the Bear can represent someone that truly cares and is invested in your future. Other times, the Bear card can represent people, that despite the best intentions, may be trying to assert themselves over our own decisions. This can be through aggression, bullying, or even more subtle influence, like that of a parent on a child who has internalized their wishes.
lenormand-15.png.title: The Bear

lenormand-16.png.description: Traditionally a symbol of wish fulfillment, the Star indicates progress towards oneâ€™s goals. As a strongly positive card, it stands for hope, positivity, and dreams coming true. Like the north star, whose guidance leads weary travelers towards their destination, our aspirations and dreams help us stay the course towards our highest ideals. This card represents both the journey towards those visions, and the dream itself. Sometimes, it can also mean hope and trust - in moments of doubt, the star beckons us to have faith that all will turn out well in the end, that the path is sometimes long and winding, it cannot always be straightforward and smooth. When we look up at the stars and contemplate the vastness of space, we are humbled - for we remember that although we are only a tiny fraction of the universe, it is all interconnected.  Our understanding of it is limited by human comprehension, meaning that sometimes, trust is all we can have.
lenormand-16.png.title: Stars

lenormand-17.png.description: When seeing the Stork in your Lenormand readings, the card can indicate changes, transitions and transformations. The Stork is known as a bird with long migratory patterns, sometimes traveling between seasons between the southernmost tip of Africa to Europe. Sometimes, this migration can be literal - you may be going through a geographical relocation. But more often, it can be a figurative movement - where you are going through a process where you are redefining certain aspects of yourself. Usually, this is something that starts from within; like the a change in the way you define love, or your own identity. This tends to shape the actions you take and how you make choices. The inward change radiates outward, and it is most times, a very slow process. To understand where in life youâ€™re changing, youâ€™ll have to take a look at the surrounding cards. Finally, since migratory patterns are seasonal, the Stork card can also indicate cycles and returns. That means you can find yourself in recurring situations or feelings.
lenormand-17.png.title: The Stork

lenormand-18.png.description: As humanityâ€™s closest companion, the Dog card in a Lenormand reading can usually indicate a deep friendship based on loyalty and support. This card can come in the form of an actual person with these traits, or being surrounded by a support system, or acts of kindness in general. Loving support can also sometimes turn into devotion, where someone focuses their entire attention towards anotherâ€™s well-being and happiness. The person in question can be quite eager to please, depending on another personâ€™s views of them for their own self esteem. In other cases, getting the Dog in a Lenormand reading can also indicate someone who his obedient, or a follower of some kind. While this can be positive, sometimes this card can also indicate someone that is unable to make decisions for themselves, and relies on others to make choices for them.
lenormand-18.png.title: The Dog

lenormand-19.png.description: When we look at a tower from down on the ground, we feel small, diminutive. From up above on the tower, looking down, weâ€™ve created a distance and boundaries. These two perspectives form the basis for  all the meanings in the Tower Lenormand card. As someone looking up at the tower, we interpret these larger than life spaces to be in positions of authority - which is why this card sometimes stands for government institutions and bureaucratic organizations. There is a sense of impenetrability to these institutions, a feeling that they are quite removed from the average person, and itâ€™s inner workings are hidden and mysterious. As someone from inside the tower, we understand that we must sometimes protect ourselves - and towers were used as fortresses to defend against  incoming attacks. Sometimes solitude is a form of self preservation, at times we must take a break from the hectic pace of life in order to recover and heal. If we extend this for too long however, this self-preservation instinct may turn into deep loneliness, and sometimes arrogance towards others.
lenormand-19.png.title: The Tower

lenormand-20.png.description: The Garden in Lenormand is more accurately represented by perhaps a Park; where many people from all over the community can congregate. The Garden represents all things that are in the public eye, and are relevant to a community of people. To see the Garden card in a Lenormand reading will be indicative of public spaces, both physical spaces and online ones. It can represent what is on television, radio, the internet, society and culture in general. Depending on the surrounding cards it can mean the release of something to the public, whether it is something tangible like a book, a product, or a business - or something like a marriage announcement, or an announcement of oneâ€™s values or commitments.
lenormand-20.png.title: The Garden

lenormand-21.png.description: When the Mountain appears in your Lenormand card readings, youâ€™ll have to beware of delays and obstacles coming your way. These problems will have to be overcome in order for your to continue progressing down your path. Whatever the form this obstacle will take, you must learn to move around it, or take it head on. Remember that this obstacle does not have to be taken negatively. Challenges in life are what force us to learn and grow. Without them, we remain stagnant. Thus, while initially the Mountain may seem daunting, there is also a sense of pride and victory that we can earn from climbing and surpassing it. The struggles that we face, and then overcome, can also become symbols of the persistence of human nature. This can be an additional dimension of the mountain card, should you choose to take the challenge that it references. It is by taking just one step at a time that we can overcome the biggest of challenges.
lenormand-21.png.title: The Mountain

lenormand-22.png.description: With many choices, comes many doubts. While you are being presented with opportunities, it seems that you must choose one path - which closes off the others. Because you know this, you are filled with hesitation. This will not be an easy task, and so your shoulders may feel heavy with the burden of this choice. Remember that you cannot avoid this burden, it is one that you must take in order to progress forward. On a greater scale, this is the card of free will - indicating that the choices are yours to make - no matter how seemingly difficult the situation may seem.
lenormand-22.png.title: The Crossroad

lenormand-23.png.description: Slow decay and deterioration are indicated by the Mice card. Though mice may initially seem harmless, many of them can become a problem when they start gnawing and nibbling away at food, resources and housing. Itâ€™s a slow process, but if not controlled, this card can cause devastating destruction. In Lenormand readings, this card can mean that something is slowly losing its force or strength - like a relationship that may be crumbling, or hope that is slowly fading. You may not even be conscious of it yet, but it is in the works - youâ€™ll have to be more alert to see what may later become an issue. Finally, because mice are sometimes carriers of disease - this card can also indicate some kind of metaphorical or internal corruption. You may be dealing with something that is tainted or polluted; there may be someone that does not have pure motivations for their actions, like a corrupt government (in the case of the tower card) for example.
lenormand-23.png.title: Mice

lenormand-24.png.description: The Heart Lenormand meaning is that of love - not necessarily romantic love, but a love that can extend to any being, and can be expressed in any way. Perhaps, another word we can use to explain this card is compassion. In some readings, especially those that are on the topic of a relationship, the heart is one of the most positive cards you can get about a romantic situation. There is a genuine and heartfelt connection here. Sometimes though, our infatuations get the best of us, and our love of someone or something may make it difficult for us to see their flaws. We can start believing what we want to believe about them. So while this card generally can be positive, we must also ask ourselves whether we are not seeing the whole picture here. When the heart shows up in readings outside of the scope of romance, it usually indicates that there is empathy, compassion and care in this reading, whether it is with friends, family or the community. Decisions here are being made with consideration to all, and with the best interests in mind.
lenormand-24.png.title: The Heart

lenormand-25.png.description: Commitment and agreements, whether in love, business or anything in between, are represented by the ring in Lenormand readings. Something links two things together, a connection - which can be both practical or emotional, mutual or one-sided. Though it can represent the link between two people or organizations, it can also represent a commitment to a principle, an idea, or a value - a pledge that one makes towards oneself. The commonality between all these readings of the ring card is that one is bound by honor, morality, and sometimes even legal arrangements. To see this card means that you must consider the weight of all the commitments that you make - that your promises reflect on your character and your standing. Sometimes, the ring appearing in a Lenormand reading can also signal a process or event that is repetitive and cyclic, and you may be feeling as though you are going around in circles.
lenormand-25.png.title: The Ring

lenormand-26.png.description: One of the more simpler cards in the deck, the Book is representative of knowledge, education and learning. It is also associated sometimes with secrets and truth - things that can be discovered with the aid of knowledge. As the card of all those that seek truth, it usually represents the process that we go through to gain knowledge, such as becoming a student, or going through a period of intense study. Another simple reading of the book Lenormand card is that of intelligence, specifically in the context of academic intelligence - the knowledge that one gets through a formal education. In some situations though, knowledge and intellectuality can also create snobbery. Some interpretations also include secret knowledge, or esoteric knowledge - what is written within a bookâ€™s pages are sometimes not yet discovered by the reader, and it is only through research and study that one can access truth.
lenormand-26.png.title: The Book

lenormand-27.png.description: Communication is the foundation of the Letter Lenormand card - in all its forms. While in the traditional sense, communication took place most commonly in the form of an actual letter, we do not have to limit our interpretations to that medium alone. This card can stand for expression in both email, text, speech, or conversations - information and knowledge which is being shared with others. The card leaves it somewhat open to whom this information is being shared with. In order to understand its contents and its recipient, the other cards surrounding it will have to be examined. Another, more specialized meaning of the Letter Lenormand card can mean documentation or paperwork of any kind. It can mean things such as diplomas, certificates, resumes, invoices and permits, for example.
lenormand-27.png.title: The Letter

lenormand-28.png.description: While the original lenormand card is called â€œmanâ€, I wanted to expand the definition of this card to focus on masculinity - all the behaviors and energy typically associated with men, but not necessarily someone who is physically male. This energy can be more logical than emotional, more aggressive than receptive, more physical than spiritual, and dependent on your own personal cultural experiences. This card can sometimes reference the querent, especially if they have a lot of masculine traits. But it can also refer to someone in the querentâ€™s life with those qualities. This person will usually be close to the querentâ€™s life - for example, a significant other, a family member or a close friend. This person plays a large part in the querentâ€™s life.  In order to understand this card, youâ€™ll have to look at the surrounding cards, which will give you more details on the characteristics of this person this refers to.
lenormand-28.png.title: The Man

lenormand-29.png.description: While the original lenormand card is called â€œwomanâ€, I wanted to expand the definition of this card to focus on femininity in general - all the behaviors and energy typically associated with women, but not necessarily someone who is physically female. This personâ€™s energy can be more emotional than logical, more receptive than aggressive, more spiritual than physical, as well as dependent on your own personal cultural experiences. This card can sometimes reference the querent, especially if they have a lot of feminine traits. But it can also refer to someone in the querentâ€™s life with those qualities. This person will usually be close to the querentâ€™s life - for example, a significant other, a family member or a close friend. This person plays a large part in the querentâ€™s life. In order to understand this card, youâ€™ll have to look at the surrounding cards, which will give you more details on the characteristics of this person this refers to.
lenormand-29.png.title: The Woman

lenormand-30.png.description: With the lily, we really find ourselves seeing two faces of the same card - faces that are profoundly paradoxical - which gives the lily card itâ€™s beauty. You can almost say, that the lily card suffers from a bit of a Madonna-whore complex. It can represent the greater struggle of femininity to walk the line between passionate sensuality and gentle innocence. When you see the card in a reading, it can either signal all things associated with sex, pleasure, and material  and bodily comfort or it can signal virtue, purity, and morality. On one hand, it represents the side of life that experiences everything through our senses - touch, smell, taste particularly, and the enjoyment of all those things. It represents intense experiences that we have through our bodies, and feeling rooted and grounded within them.  On the other hand, the lily is rather ethereal - we find her representing all that is virtuous and good - mercy, justice, kindness, as well as pure intentions and a pure heart.
lenormand-30.png.title: The Lily

lenormand-31.png.description: An extremely positive card in Lenormand decks, the Sun is a card of victory, happiness and success. As the giver of life, having the Sun in your reading shines a light onto the situation, and the other cards within the spread. It lends a general sense of optimism to the reading, that things are being done with happiness and and warmth. It illuminates a dark situation - even when there are more negative cards in the reading. As the source of light, it not only brings happiness or hope to what can be negative, it also can illuminate that which is hidden, bringing truth from the unknown. Thus, the sun can also represent something becoming visible and coming into your awareness.
lenormand-31.png.title: The Sun

lenormand-32.png.description: It is at night, under the cover of darkness and the light of the moon when we are able to dream, and access our subconscious. The daylight no longer reigns supreme, logic and truth become more arbitrary concepts, and our minds can imagine and follow the winding paths of our intuition. What is not addressed in the light of day, comes out at night - all our hidden and repressed emotions, fears, and desires. As such, the moon tends to represent our emotional life - perhaps parts of ourselves that we cannot address in the waking day - the darker shadow aspects of our own selves that we must confront and integrate in order to develop as human beings. It is through our intuition that we may gain certain insights that we might not have found through logical understanding - so the moon can represent too, all things that exist but we are not yet knowledgeable about. Things may have been brewing underneath the surface, but perhaps your consciousness has not processed it yet.
lenormand-32.png.title: The Moon

lenormand-33.png.description: When we see the Key in our Lenormand readings, we are coming across something that will open up new pathways for us. That means that what was perhaps an obstacle for you in the past is now dissolving. This new pathway can be interpreted in several ways - sometimes it can be the removal of a physical obstacle, or it can come in the form of a new way of thinking that lets you open your eyes and your heart to new possibilities and perspectives - a revelation of some sort that gives you a new solution. Other times, the Key can also mean freedom from past restrictions; imagine being locked up in a cell where, but finally having the key to get out. Whether real or psychological, the key can represent freedom from some kind of confinement. Finally, the Key can mean achievement, for it gives us access to what we need in order to make it through to the other side, and achieve our goals.
lenormand-33.png.title: The Key

lenormand-34.png.description: Wealth is what is referenced when seeing the Fish in a Lenormand reading. This can be in the standard traditional sense of material goods - concerning finances and business, or it can be in a simpler sense of having many of something, or understanding the value of something. Thus, when looking at the cards, it can simply mean the cards are speaking about something in the financial realm, or the card can really help us examine what it is that is valuable to us. Some things are worthless on paper, but emotionally valuable - a principle, a feeling, an object or something you do. The Fish card also asks us to think about what abundance really means - whether it is the quantity of something or another trait. A negative trait about this card is that it tends to focus on numbers rather than other qualities that we might find more compelling.
lenormand-34.png.title: The Fish

lenormand-35.png.description: To see the Anchor in your Lenormand reading signals your tenacity at reaching a goal or completing a task. Despite whatever setbacks or tricky situations you find yourself in, you remain steadfast in your choices. Something is giving you the strength and the stability to keep you focused on your desires in the changing winds. The solid focus that the anchor imparts can either be positive or negative - on one hand it creates an environment of safety, but it can also mean that you can become so inflexible that you cannot let go of ideas, concepts or goals that are not really serving you. Whether the anchor in your Lenormand reading becomes a positive or negative force is something that is up to you, and how you choose to use it in the context of your life.
lenormand-35.png.title: The Anchor

lenormand-36.png.description: While the Cross can be representative of organized religion, this Lenormand cardâ€™s meaning can also be expanded to include the concepts of ideology and responsibility - such as when we come across the phrase â€œoneâ€™s cross to bearâ€. Ideologies direct our goals, our actions and our values - they create a division between what is â€œgoodâ€ and what is â€œbadâ€. They tell us what we should do and what we should not do, and can become incredibly harmful when taken to extremes. It is through ideologies that we learn to judge others, and judge ourselves - sometimes going too far and creating a culture of intolerance. Because ideologies have value judgements, they become closely tied with this Lenormand cardâ€™s other meanings. Sometimes what is considered the â€œrightâ€ thing to do can drive us towards great accomplishments and fulfillment, but it can also, especially in cases where those ideals and principles are far too extreme, become a heavy burden. We cannot be perfect creatures all the time, we are only human.
lenormand-36.png.title: The Cross

lenormand_pairs.subtitle: Possible Pair Interpretations
lenormand_pairs.title: Pair Interpretations

png.0: My imagination guides me to making my dreams a reality.
png.1: There is delight in playful creation.

love-relationship.rev: Emotional immaturity or misunderstandings might be causing some turbulence between you two. Itâ€™s possible that one of you is struggling to express feelings clearly, leading to confusion or even hurt. Take a step back and really listen to each other; open, honest communication can work wonders. Remember, it's okay to be vulnerable and share your true emotions. This could be a chance to grow together and strengthen your bond.
love-relationship.up: Expect a wave of fresh emotions and heartfelt communication. This card often signals a time when you and your partner might explore new depths of your connection, perhaps through shared creative pursuits or simply more open, honest conversations. It's a beautiful reminder to stay curious and playful with each other, allowing your relationship to grow in unexpected and delightful ways. Embrace the innocence and wonder that comes with rediscovering each other, and let your hearts lead the way.

love-searching.rev: Do you feel like you're chasing shadows? You might find yourself entangled in fleeting infatuations or encountering people who seem emotionally unavailable. It's a time to reflect on whether your heart is truly open or if past disappointments are casting long shadows over new possibilities. Embrace this moment as an opportunity for self-discovery and emotional growth, allowing you to attract connections that resonate with your true self.
love-searching.up: New romantic possibilities are on the horizon, and they might come from unexpected places. Stay open to new experiences and let your curiosity guide you. This is a time to embrace your playful side and let your heart lead the way. Trust your intuition and don't be afraid to express your feelings, even if it feels a bit vulnerable. You never know, a simple gesture or a heartfelt conversation could spark something truly magical.

money.rev: Feelings scatteredness or impulsiveness with your finances might lead to unexpected expenses that catch you off guard at this time. It's crucial to take a step back and reassess your budget, ensuring you're not letting whimsical desires overshadow practical needs. Perhaps there's an opportunity for creative financial solutions you've overlookedâ€”think outside the box but stay grounded in reality. Be cautious of emotional spending; itâ€™s easy to justify little splurges that add up quickly. Remember, clarity and discipline now can pave the way for future stability and growth.
money.up: Creative ideas could be leading to unexpected financial opportunities right now. Embrace your intuition; itâ€™s guiding you towards ventures that resonate deeply with your passions. While the path may seem unconventional, trust in the serendipity of new beginnings and fresh perspectives. Be open to learning and exploring, as this period is ripe for growth and discovery in your financial landscape.

png.reversed: I ground my emotions to navigate the practical world wisely.

work.rev: You might find yourself feeling creatively blocked or uninspired, leading to a sense of stagnation in your career. Perhaps you're struggling with unrealistic expectations or daydreaming more than taking actionable steps. It's possible that emotional immaturity is causing conflicts with colleagues, making teamwork challenging. Reflect on whether you're truly passionate about your current path or if it's time for a change to reignite your enthusiasm and drive.
work.up: In your career, you might find yourself brimming with fresh ideas and creative inspiration, almost as if a new muse has entered your professional life. This could be the perfect time to explore innovative projects or take on roles that allow for artistic expression. You may also encounter unexpected opportunities that align closely with your passions, urging you to follow your heart rather than just logic. Embrace this period of emotional intelligence and intuition; it can lead to profound personal growth and fulfillment in your work environment.

png.0: Beauty, art and wonder is everywhere.
png.1: How I present myself is just another method of expression.

love-relationship.rev: Emotions might be running high, leading to misunderstandings or unrealistic expectations between you two. It's possible that one of you is feeling a bit disillusioned or let down, perhaps because of unmet promises or a lack of follow-through. This could be a time to have an honest conversation about your needs and desires, ensuring you're both on the same page. Remember, it's okay to address these issues; it can actually strengthen your bond in the long run.
love-relationship.up: Your relationship might be entering a phase of deeper emotional connection and romance, where heartfelt gestures and sincere communication become more frequent. It's a time to embrace vulnerability and share your dreams and aspirations with each other. This card often suggests that one of you is ready to take the lead in expressing love and affection, creating a more harmonious and fulfilling bond. Be open to the flow of emotions and let your intuition guide you in nurturing this beautiful connection.

love-searching.rev: Some potential partners seem charming but lack depth. You might find yourself entangled in fleeting romances that promise much yet deliver little, leaving you yearning for genuine connection. It's a time to be cautious of those who wear their hearts on their sleeves but fail to back it up with consistent actions. Reflect on what truly matters to you and don't settle for less than someone who aligns with your values and dreams.

faq.a: On app stores, Google and Apple take a 15% fee off the top of any transaction. On web, the fees are roughly 10% less than on the app stores -- so we're passing the savings on to you.
faq.q: How come everything is more expensive on your mobile app?

faq.a: Yes! As long as you're signed into the same Labyrinthos account, you'll have the same features available on android and iOS apps too. On web, all permissions are associated with your email; which is why you need to create an account before you can purchase premium. Remember that on the mobile app, you can purchase a subscription without an account; which is impossible on web. To link your Labyrinthos account with a previously purchased subscription, make sure to restore purchases when you're logged in!
faq.q: If I purchase a subscription on the web app, will it also be available on mobile?

faq.a: Most permissions will also be available on the web app. The caveat we have is paid decks. Right now, our contract with other artists and publishers only includes usage in mobile apps for android and iOS. We're working on getting the permissions to use them for web as well.
faq.q: Will all my decks and premium features be available in the web app?

faq.a: Yes! Remember that you need to cancel in the original payment form you purchased with. If you purchased your subscription with Google Play, they handle your cancellations. Same for Apple. If you purchased on web, you can cancel right here on the platform.

Atanas A.Atanassov: Atanas Atanassov is a talented author and illustrator known for his captivating artwork on tarot decks such as the Golden Tarot of the Renaissance and the Medieval Scapini Tarot, making significant contributions to the world of mystical and esoteric literature.

creator.Bonifacio Bembo: Bonifacio Bembo was an Italian artist renowned for his role in creating the Visconti-Sforza tarot deck, one of the most significant and historical tarot decks from the Renaissance period. His work is celebrated for its intricate detail and contribution to the early development of tarot art and symbolism.
creator.Fabio Listrani: Fabio Listrani (Rome, Italy) is an award-winning artist who has illustrated for various international entities, including Marvel, Titan Comics, Heavy Metal, and IDW Publishing. He is also the creator of Night Sun Tarot and Santa Muerte Tarot.
creator.Giulia Massaglia: Giulia Massaglia is an artist based in Italy whose work includes the Tarot Mucha, Golden Art Nouveau Tarot, Egyptian Art Nouveau Tarot, and After Tarot Deck.
creator.Leon Carre: (1878 - 1942) A French Orientalist painter and illustrator, noted for illustrating the book, The Book of One Thousand and One Nights.
creator.Nicolas Conver: An artisan in the 1700's that produced the Tarot de Marseille, whose deck would become the basis for the first esoteric use of tarot. Prior to this time, tarot was often used as playing cards.
creator.Pamela Coleman Smith: Pamela Colman Smith is a visionary artist who defined English-speaking Tarot with her timeless illustrations.
creator.Severino Baraldi: Severino started as a chalk pavement artist before pursuing a career in illustration, while working in advertising. Baraldi has had a long career illustrating children's classics, historical illustrations, educational books, and magazines, while creating a vast portfolio of more than 220 books and 7,500 illustrations.
creator.Tina Gong: Tina is the big ol' tarot nerd that made this app and illustrated all the Labyrinthos decks. Prior to building Labyrinthos she was an illustrator and UX / UI person. She lives in NYC with her husband and her cat while attempting to manage her humiliating, crippling addiction to alpaca plushies.

deck.AIS:
Discover the Arcana Iris Sacra Tarot Deck, a vintage-inspired treasure translating to "Mysteries of the Sacred Rainbow" from Latin. Drawing from Golden Dawn, Kabbalah, and astrology traditions, each card is a vivid canvas of color symbolism. Red embodies willpower and creativity, blue delves into emotions, yellow sparks intellect, and green grounds in the material world. Moreover, every card features a rainbow swirling, twisting, or beaming, indicating its primal energy focus. Dive into this kaleidoscope of wisdom to unlock profound insights and embark on a journey of self-discovery, where vibrant hues guide you through the labyrinth of consciousness.

78 Cards. Features book-shaped box, gold hardware corners, sturdy matte card stock, ribbon enclosure, and gold foil edges.
deck.ALDIS:
Dive into the mystical tapestry of the Arcana Iris Sacra Lenormand Deck, where each card holds a world of secrets waiting to be unveiled. With an aura of enchantment and a hint of intrigue, this deck offers a glimpse into the hidden realms of the subconscious. Delicately illustrated and steeped in symbolism, these cards guide you through the intricate dance of fate and fortune. Whether you're a seasoned oracle enthusiast or a curious novice, the Arcana Iris Sacra Lenormand Deck promises to illuminate your path with clarity and insight. Embark on a journey of divination and discovery, and let the magic of the Lenormand cards reveal the mysteries of your future.

38 Cards. Features book-shaped box, gold hardware corners, sturdy matte card stock, ribbon enclosure, and gold foil edges.
deck.CADIS:
Enter the ethereal world of the Claves Astrologicae Astrology Oracle Deck, where celestial mysteries intertwine with earthly wisdom. With a subtle allure and enigmatic charm, each card in this deck whispers ancient secrets of the stars. Delve into the depths of astrology and unlock the cosmic forces that shape your destiny. Whether you're a seasoned stargazer or a curious seeker, the Claves Astrologicae Oracle Deck offers profound insights and timeless guidance. Let the stars be your guide as you navigate the intricacies of life's journey and uncover the hidden truths that lie within. Embark on a celestial voyage unlike any other and illuminate your path with cosmic wisdom.

45 Cards. Features book-shaped box, gold hardware corners, sturdy matte card stock, ribbon enclosure, and gold foil edges.
deck.GTL:
Introducing the Golden Thread Lenormand Deck, a timeless treasure crafted for seekers of clarity and insight. Embrace the elegant simplicity of this deck, where each card holds a wealth of wisdom waiting to be revealed. Drawing upon the rich tradition of Lenormand divination, these cards offer guidance and illumination on matters of love, career, and beyond. With its delicate artwork and profound symbolism, the Golden Thread Lenormand Deck serves as a trusted companion on your journey of self-discovery. Let these cards be your guide as you navigate life's twists and turns, and uncover the hidden truths that lie within.

38 Cards. Features recycled black plastic card stock for a smooth and flexible shuffling experience, sturdy lift top box with gold foil, and gold foil imagery on every card.
deck.GTT:
Step into the realm of ancient wisdom with the Golden Thread Tarot Deck, a timeless treasure for seekers of insight and illumination. Crafted with exquisite attention to detail and infused with profound symbolism, each card in this deck serves as a portal to the depths of your subconscious mind. Whether you're a seasoned practitioner or new to the tarot journey, the Golden Thread Tarot beckons you to explore the mysteries of the universe and unlock the secrets of your soul. Let these cards be your guide as you navigate life's labyrinth, and discover the golden thread that connects you to the divine.

78 Cards. Features recycled black plastic card stock for a smooth and flexible shuffling experience, sturdy lift top box with gold foil, and gold foil imagery on every card.
deck.LS_1001:
Intertwined images of fairy tales and stories. Symbols that carry the scent of distant lands, of incense and spices. The sigh of the Orient winds through the arabesques of the Thousand and One Nights, between palaces of precious stones, deserts and enchanted cities, between princes and beggars. Night after night, card after card.

Gorgeous, whimsical and fantastic illustrations that quickly transport you to another land. 78 Cards, reversible backs and tuck box.
deck.LS_MCT:
Some decks whisper. Some decks shout. This deck meows. The Marseille deckâ€”one of the original Tarot decks of the worldâ€”is now updated for the twenty-first century with adorable cats! The fabulous feline motifs of this unique deck add a cozy touch to any tarot collection and are sure to become favorites of tarot readers around the world.

78 Cards. Features bright and cheerful illustrations, reversible backs and tuck box.
deck.LS_RT:
Since love is among the greatest forces, being romantic turns out to be a journey, a point of view and the promise to look at the world with the eyes of the heart. This Tarot deck will help you get in touch with your feelings and understand them better.

78 Cards. Features soft, dreamy and nostalgic illustrations referencing the Victorian period, reversible backs and tuck box.
deck.LS_SMT:
Introducing the Santa Muerte Tarot, a mesmerizing fusion of mysticism and artistry that delves into the depths of the human psyche. Created by artist Fabio Listrani, this deck pays homage to the revered Mexican folk saint, Santa Muerte, guiding you through life's trials and triumphs with grace and insight. Each card is a masterpiece of symbolism, inviting you to explore the mysteries of mortality and transcendence. Whether you're seeking guidance on love, career, or personal growth, the Santa Muerte Tarot offers profound wisdom and clarity. Embrace the power of the underworld and embark on a journey of transformation with this captivating deck.

78 Cards. Features vivid and colorful illustrations, reversible backs and sturdy vertical lift top box.
deck.LS_TB: A reinterpretation of Botticelli's artwork by an artistic master, rich with mysterious meanings. The symbols in Botticelli's works subtly convey a harmonious vision of Nature, blending ideals of beauty with esoteric and religious dimensions. For the attentive observer, the cards reveal profound truths that deepen with careful analysis of each intricate detail.
deck.LS_TM:
A stunning tribute to Art Nouveau pioneer Alphonse Mucha, this deck embraces the fresh beauty of the early 20th century, along with the eternal wisdom and understanding of tarot cards.

78 Cards. Features vivid and colorful illustrations, reversible backs and sturdy vertical lift top box.
deck.LS_VT: The Visconti-Sforza tarot deck, dating back to the 15th century, is one of the earliest and most renowned tarot decks, created for the Visconti and Sforza families of Milan. Its imagery features richly detailed and elaborate illustrations that reflect the opulence and artistic style of the Renaissance era. The deck originally consisted of 74 cards, distinguished by its elaborate gold leaf accents and intricate symbolism. This particular version is a masterful restoration by A.A. Atanassov, who has lovingly recreated the deck to preserve its historical authenticity and aesthetic grandeur.
deck.LST:
Step into the enigmatic realm of the Luminous Spirit Tarot Deck, where ancient wisdom meets contemporary allure. Behold the mesmerizing holographic beauty that adorns each card, beckoning you to delve into the depths of your psyche. With a subtle allure and a touch of mystery, this deck whispers secrets of the cosmos, inviting you to unlock hidden truths and explore the mysteries of the universe. Whether you're a seasoned seeker or a curious novice, the Luminous Spirit Tarot holds the keys to profound insights and profound revelations. Embark on a journey of self-discovery unlike any other and let the mysteries unfold.

78 Cards. Features vertical box with holographic foil detailing and full holographic back.
deck.RWS1910:
Step into the enchanting world of Tarot with our digital restoration of The Classic 1910 Tarot Cards, brought to life by the incredible artistry of Pamela Colman Smith. For over a century, Smith's transcendent art has been the hallmark of Tarot in the English-speaking world.

Immerse yourself in the vibrant and pristine imagery of each card, meticulously restored to capture every nuance of the deck. Discover the incredible artistry and symbolism of the original deck, just as they were when they were first published in 1910.

Deck Photos by Cecilia Miraldi.
deck.SSAO:
Embark on a celestial journey with the Seventh Sphere Astrology Oracle, a captivating blend of mysticism and cosmic insight. Each card in this exquisite deck is infused with the wisdom of the stars, offering profound guidance and illumination. With its elegant design and rich symbolism, the Seventh Sphere Oracle invites you to explore the mysteries of the cosmos and unlock the secrets of your soul's journey. Whether you're a seasoned astrologer or a curious seeker, these cards will deepen your connection to the celestial forces that shape your destiny. Let the Seventh Sphere Oracle be your guiding light as you navigate the vast expanse of the universe and discover the hidden treasures that await within.

45 Cards. Features blue holographic detailing on each card, blue holographic edges, sturdy matte card stock, and magnetic box with blue holographic details.
deck.SSL:
Discover the Seventh Sphere Lenormand Deck, a captivating journey into the realm of divination and insight. With its intricate artwork and timeless symbolism, each card holds a story waiting to unfold. Delve into the mysteries of the Lenormand tradition and unlock the secrets of the universe. Whether you're a seasoned practitioner or a curious novice, the Seventh Sphere Lenormand Deck offers clarity and guidance on your path. Let these cards be your companions as you navigate life's twists and turns, and embrace the wisdom they bring to your readings. Welcome to a world where every card holds a message, waiting to be revealed.

38 Cards. Features magnetic box with rose gold details, sturdy matte card stock, full-bleed illustrations and rose gold foil edges.
deck.SST:
Enter the enchanting realm of the Seventh Sphere Tarot Deck, a modern interpretation of the Tarot de Marseille adorned with captivating rose gold details. Each card in this exquisite deck is a testament to gentle elegance and sophistication, with intricate rose gold accents adding a touch of luxury to every reading. Whether you're a seasoned tarot enthusiast or a curious beginner, the Seventh Sphere Tarot beckons you to explore the mysteries of your inner cosmos with style and grace. Let the shimmering rose gold imagery guide you on your journey of self-discovery, as you unlock the secrets of the universe one card at a time.

80 Cards. Features magnetic box with rose gold details, sturdy matte card stock, full-bleed illustrations with rose gold details and rose gold foil edges.
deck.SSTRWS:
Immerse yourself in the captivating world of the Seventh Sphere Rider-Waite Smith Tarot Deck, where full-bleed illustrations and mesmerizing blue holographic foil bring each card to life. Journey through the timeless wisdom of the Rider-Waite-Smith tradition with a modern twist, as every card in this exquisite deck is adorned with vibrant imagery that extends to the edges, immersing you in its magic. The addition of blue holographic foil adds an enchanting touch, casting a spell of wonder and intrigue with every shuffle. Whether you're a seasoned tarot practitioner or a curious novice, let the Seventh Sphere Tarot Deck be your guide to illuminating the journey to yourself in style and elegance.

38 Cards. Features magnetic box with blue holographic details, sturdy matte card stock, full-bleed illustrations with blue holographic details and blue holographic edges.
deck.TDM_LABY:
First published in 1760, the Tarot de Marseille is one of the earliest known tarot decks. Our version takes the original 1760 cards, traces over them with our own line-art while adding some minor corrections. We also recolored it with some some more pleasing colors.

78 Cards.
deck.TVM:
Welcome to the enchanting world of the Tarot of the Velvet Moon, where shadows dance and mysteries abound. With its lush, velvety artwork and evocative symbolism, each card in this exquisite deck invites you to embark on a journey of self-discovery and transformation. Whether you're seeking clarity on matters of the heart or guidance on your life's path, the Tarot of the Velvet Moon offers profound insights and deep wisdom. Let these cards be your companions as you navigate the twists and turns of existence, and uncover the hidden truths that lie within. Embrace the magic of the moonlit night and let your intuition be your guide.

78 Cards. Features magnetic box with holographic gold foil details, sturdy matte card stock, subtle gold ink details on each card and holographic gold foil edges. Miniature size.

faq.a:
Labyrinthos currently supports about 2.25 million users, less than 1% of which are paying customers. This is because we have a generous and robust free product. But without limits to journal entries, some users that use this app for business purposes often create 200-300 journal entries a day, quickly escalating monthly data storage fees. This is not sustainable.

Labyrinthos is a passion project literally run by one person. We have never had outside investment or funding.

As a creator, I had no idea that this app would have gotten as popular as it did. Never in my wildest dreams did I think that I would be building and supporting a product with so many users. I am grateful for all your support, and I would like to keep it alive and running for as long as I possibly can. But Labyrinthos can't survive if it becomes a burden on my family.

To help free users that cannot afford to pay, we made it easy to export all your journal entries, so you'll never have to lose them.

There are no advertisements in this app; we rely on in-app-purchases or subscriptions to function. Storage is our largest cost, and it keeps increasing every month. Our bills keep getting larger and larger the more users we get. But by putting limits on journal entries, it eliminates the unpredictability of the future, and will stabilize costs going forward, so we can continue to support access to our free product and remain a resource for fellow tarot lovers and enthusiasts everywhere.

Thank you for understanding! ðŸ¸ðŸ’–
faq.q: Why is there a limit on journal entries?

faq.a:
Even though we pay server costs every month, we're offering these lifetime storage upgrades as a one-time purchase.

Each pack adds to the base number of 100 entries, so if you purchased all the upgrades, your maximum limit would be 1100. If you purchase the 100 page expansion only, your maximum limit would be 200.
faq.q: Are these expansions a one-time purchase or subscription?

faq.a:
Yes! You can export your entries so they exist outside the app. There are different formats for exported entries. Plaintext is a simple .txt file. Secure exports allow you to save the file and re-upload it into your journal later on if you decide to purchase upgrades. Finally PDF's are beautifully presented documents with images that are easily referenced. If you are exporting to PDF, be aware that because PDF creation is so taxing on certain devices, you can only export a maximum of 10 at a time.

Exporting and clearing your journal offers a way for you to never lose your readings, while also keeping costs for us low, so we can continue to keep this app running.
faq.q: I don't want to upgrade my journal. Is there an alternative?

faq.a:
Yes. Premium users have effectively no limits on journal entries as long as you are subscribed.

If you're a professional reader with more than 50k+ entries and are saving 200-300 readings a day, we highly recommend you sign up for premium. It's a tax write off anyway!
faq.q: Is there an unlimited journal entry option?

faq.a: If you create more journal entries than your original limit, you won't be able to save any new readings unless you delete enough to remain under your original limit. No readings will be lost unless you click delete, just remember to export them first!
faq.q: What happens if my subscription to premium lapses?

faq.a: Already purchased all the upgrades but still need more slots? Please message the Headmistress at faculty@labyrinthos.co and put in a request.
faq.q: What if I need even more entries?
