algiz.description:
Represented by the elk, Algiz symbolizes protection and defense. You are under the safeguard of spiritual protection and your powerful inner strength is enough to help you manifest your dreams. It seems you have guides watching over you, providing support and shielding you from negative influence. This rune acts as a protective shield, guarding you against harm. By acknowledging, harnessing and leaning into this feeling of being protected, you can pursue your goals with greater confidence.

Spiritually, Algiz is also a symbol of awakening and heightened intuition. You are becoming more attuned to your inner self. This rune encourages you to trust your instincts and to use your intuition. Embrace the protection and support you are receiving, and use this heightened awareness to move forward with clarity and purpose.
algiz.reversal:
Reversed Algiz may be a warning; or perhaps also indicate a sense of helplessness. You might be feeling vulnerable now; that you lack the protection you need in a particular area of your life. Perhaps your current challenges make you feel exposed or unsupported.

There is a need now to address feelings of insecurity, and reassess from where you are seeking protection and support. It may signal that you need to strengthen your defenses. Confront your feelings of vulnerability and to work on rebuilding your sense of security and intuition.
algiz.title: Elk

ansuz.description:
Ansuz, the rune of communication, is deeply connected to the wisdom of the ancestral god Odin. Literally meaning mouth, it signifies the arrival of divine insight or a message that carries profound meaning. This rune embodies the essence of clear, truthful communication, whether it comes through spoken words, written texts, or intuitive understanding. It is a symbol of wisdom, guidance, and the power of language to inspire and uplift. Ansuz encourages you to listen closely to the messages around you, whether from others, the universe, or your own inner voice, as they may contain the knowledge or inspiration you need to move forward.

This rune represents the flow of wisdom from higher realms, reminding you of the importance of staying open to learning and growth. Truth often has a way of revealing itself when you are receptive and attentive. Words and ideas are powerful, and you must use them wisely and with integrity. Communication is a two-way street; we must listen as much as we speak in order to find the meaning of that which lies under the surface.

You are being invited to engage in honest and meaningful dialogue, seek out and share knowledge, be inspired by the wisdom of those who have come before, and to communicate with clarity and purpose. Aligning with Ansuz provides you the transformative power of truth and the importance of conveying your thoughts and ideas with authenticity and honesty.
ansuz.reversal:
Ansuz reversed suggests that communication may be clouded or distorted, leading to misunderstandings, deceit, or manipulation. The clarity and wisdom that typically flow through this rune are blocked, and you may find yourself struggling with miscommunication or receiving mixed signals from those around you. This reversal can indicate that important messages are being lost in translation, or that someone may be intentionally misleading you. There is a need for greater discernment and caution in how you communicate and who you trust. This rune is a warning that the truth may be obscured or that you may be misinterpreting the information you receive. Take the time to pause and reassess the situation, ensuring that you are not being swayed by falsehoods or manipulated by othersâ€™ words.

You are being called upon to seek clarity and to be more vigilant in your communications. Double-check your understanding, avoid jumping to conclusions, and be wary of those who may not have your best interests at heart. By doing so, you can protect yourself from confusion and miscommunication.
ansuz.title: Mouth

berkano.description:
Berkana represents birth, fertility, and creation. It is a rune associated with the Birch tree, and signifies a time of growth and renewal. This is not only in the literal sense of birth, but also in the creation and development of new projects, partnerships, or personal transformations. This rune reflects a period of mental and physical growth, highlighting regenerative power and the liberation of your spirit.

Spiritually, Berkana embodies the energy of nurturing and development. It indicates that you are in a phase of significant positive change, where your creative and regenerative energies are flourishing. You are being encouraged to trust in this process of rapid growth and change, whether itâ€™s related to personal goals, relationships, or new ventures.

Now is the time to nurture new ideas and projects, allowing them to develop and flourish. Enjoy the process of creation and recognize its potential. You are being put on a more vibrant and fulfilling path.
keywords_reversal: more for the sake of more
berkano.reversal:
Reversed, Berkana can indicate what happens when we focus on growth without ensuring that we remain aligned to our greater purpose. At first, progress can be exhilarating, pushing you to do more and more. Growth without an end, and without purpose, however, can lead to burnout and frustration.

You may find yourself expanding endlessly but feeling unfulfilled, as if youâ€™re spinning your wheels without making meaningful strides. This lack of alignment can also result in anxiety and a sense of disconnection from your core values, causing you to question the true significance of your efforts. Remember to balance your growth with a clear sense of direction and purpose.
berkano.title: Birch

dagaz.description:
Dagaz represents the dawn; it is the end of one cycle and the beginning of another. A time of new beginnings and breakthroughs is on the horizon. A kind of awakening is in the works, bringing transformative awareness and new possibilities. This can be an auspicious moment to embark on fresh ventures.

This rune embodies the power of renewal and the certainty that follows a period of transformation. It represents hope and security, marking the successful completion of a cycle and the readiness to step into a new phase with optimism and clarity. Changes that are occuring now will lead you towards a brighter future. You are being called upon to seize the opportunities for growth.
dagaz.title: Dawn

ehwaz.description:
Represented by the horse, Ehwaz signifies progress, movement, and the value of trust and teamwork. Steady and positive change is happening now and you are moving forward in a gradual and reliable manner. This rune highlights the importance of progress through consistent effort and the benefits of teamwork and mutual trust.

Ehwaz also embodies the qualities of loyalty and cooperation. You are supported by others and your relationships and partnerships are reliable. Work on maintaining trust and cooperation, knowing that the journey may be slow, steady but ultimately rewarding. This rune highlights the power of discipline and gradual progress while also recognizing the value of working together with others. Steady, incremental changes can lead to significant achievements.
ehwaz.reversal:
You may be dealing with a sense of restlessness, mistrust, or disharmony. Movement or progress may feel stalled, unsettled or out of sync with your current path. Challenges in your relationships or partnerships can create a sense of mistrust or discord.

Now may be a time where you must first work on rebuilding trust and cooperation. Where are you feeling restless or hasty? How can you improve communication and collaboration with others?
ehwaz.title: Horse

eihwaz.description:
The yew tree is deeply connected to the Tree of Life in Norse mythology, Yggdrasil. Eihwaz represents the cyclical nature of existence and its transformative energy. Now can be a time of profound change, renewal, and the natural progression from one phase of life to another. This rune embodies the idea of shedding old ways to embrace new beginnings, marking the end of a cycle and the start of a new one. Reflect on the natural cycles of your life and to embrace transformation as a necessary and positive force.

Eihwaz is also a symbol of divine protection and wisdom. It suggests a strong connection to higher realms and the divine, offering enlightenment and guidance through these challenging transitions. This rune highlights a sense of purpose and the interconnectedness of all aspects of existence, encouraging you to have faith that the changes in your life are happening as they need to. Allow the understanding of the interconnectedness of all things to guide you through life's transitions.
eihwaz.title: Yew

fehu.description:
Fehu embodies the essence of new beginnings, the spark of inspiration that can lead to greater fulfillment. It invites you to reflect on what you truly value and to align your actions with those values to attract abundance in all forms. Fehu is a reminder that wealth is not merely about accumulation but about the flow and exchange of energy, where giving and receiving are in harmony. As the first rune of the Elder Futhark, represents more than just material wealth; itâ€™s a symbol of energy in motion, the force behind creation and the flow of resources. You are being reminded of the potential for prosperity, not just in terms of financial gain, but in the richness of experiences, relationships, and personal growth. This rune speaks to the power of intention and the ability to manifest your desires into reality. It encourages you to harness your inner strength and direct it towards your goals, knowing that the energy you put out into the world will return to you in kind.

Remember to create a balance between the physical and spiritual realms; pursue wealth that is both meaningful and sustainable. Fehu emphasizes the importance of earned income, as well as recognizing the resources already available to youâ€”be they talents, connections, or opportunitiesâ€”and to use them wisely. By embracing the energy of this rune, you open yourself up to possibilities, where your efforts are rewarded not just with material gain, but with a deep sense of satisfaction and purpose.
fehu.reversal:
Reversed, Fehu signals a potential disruption in the flow of abundance, whether thatâ€™s through material loss, dwindling resources, or feelings of inadequacy. This rune invites you to reflect on where your energy might be blocked or misaligned, causing these struggles to manifest. You may be clinging too tightly to material possessions or are overly focused on external validation, leading to feelings of insecurity.

You may be challenged now to reassess your relationship with wealth and success. Itâ€™s a reminder that true abundance comes from within, and that periods of loss or struggle can offer valuable lessons in resilience and resourcefulness. By addressing the root of these issues, you can begin to restore balance and reestablish the flow of positive energy in your life.
fehu.title: Cattle

gebo.description:
Gebo represents the exchange of energy and the blessings that come from both giving and receiving. It is a symbol of generosity, balance, and the positive flow of relationships. You are surrounded by an abundance of gifts and talents. Someone now may offer you significant blessings and support. This rune highlights the importance of reciprocity and the mutual exchange of value, whether through tangible gifts, acts of kindness, or shared resources.

Spiritually, this rune represents the concept of balance in your interactions with others. Embrace generosity and recognize the gifts you have been given. Remember to use them to enrich both your own life and the lives of those around you. What matters most is the quality of your relationships and the harmony you cultivate in your exchanges. Remember to nurture positive relationships.You are being reminded of the profound joy and fulfillment that comes from sharing and connecting with others.
gebo.title: Gift

hagalaz.description:
Hagalaz is symbolized by hail, representing sudden and often disruptive change, much like a storm that can strike unexpectedly and cause significant damage. This rune heralds a period of upheaval or crisis that feels beyond your control. This type of change, while challenging, is often necessary for clearing away obstacles and making way for new growth. Much like the Tower, it highlights the potential for dramatic shifts that can reshape your life.

Such crises, though difficult, are opportunities for profound transformation and learning. The storm brought by Hagalaz can force you to confront your worst fears, offering valuable lessons in resilience and adaptability. Weather the storm with grace and to use the experience to grow stronger and wiser. Hagalaz is a catalyst for personal evolution. Some disruptions are inevitable, but you can focus on how you respond to them. By finding ways to adapt, you can turn what seems like a destructive force into a powerful opportunity.
hagalaz.title: Hail

ingwaz.description:
The rune Ingwaz is associated with the earth god Ing, symbolizing virility, and overall well-being. This can be a time of positive growth and productivity, reflecting the generative energies of the Earth. This rune emphasizes the importance of family, ancestry, and the completion of important tasks or projects.

Now can be the time of fulfilling long-term goals and the tying up of loose ends. Focus on personal and family well-being. It can be especially satisfying to complete important tasks or achieve long-standing goals now. This rune also often indicates that there is strength to be found in your lineage and a connection to your roots and heritage. This rune encourages you to honor your ancestry and to appreciate the foundations that support your current and future endeavors.
ingwaz.title: Ing

isa.description:
Isa represents a period of stillness and pause, much like ice itself. This rune indicates that you may need to halt and take a break from taking active action. This pause, while it might feel like being stuck in a standstill, can be an opportunity to gain perspective and gather necessary information. Now is a time for reflection; allow events to unfold at their own pace and give yourself the space to properly assess your situation.

What feels like a period of stagnation can also be a chance for deeper insight and understanding. Not all progress is linear; sometimes stepping back is essential for making informed decisions and achieving clarity. This rune signifies that patience and introspection are crucial at this moment, and that the frustrations or psychological blocks you might be experiencing are part of the process of unfolding and growth.

Use this time of waiting constructively. Rather than feeling frustrated, view it as an opportunity to reassess your goals, complete your research, and prepare yourself for next steps. Embrace the stillness and use it to your advantage, it too is a vital part of your path forward.
isa.title: Ice

jera.description:
Symbolized by the harvest, Jera represents the culmination of efforts and the reward for your hard work. You are now ready to reap the benefits of what you have sown. This rune highlights a time of abundance and prosperity, where you can enjoy the fruits of your labor and the results of your dedication. Take a moment to celebrate achievements and acknowledge the progress youâ€™ve made. If youâ€™re not currently experiencing an abundance of blessings, Jera suggests that a breakthrough may be on the horizon, or now is a good time to take stock of what you do have and practice gratitude. Recognizing and appreciating the positive aspects of your life can shift your perspective and attract more blessings.

Spiritually, Jera reflects the natural cycles of life and the rhythm of growth and renewal. It reminds you of the interconnectedness of all things and the importance of honoring the cycles of nature. Lifeâ€™s cycles include both times of plenty and periods of scarcity.
jera.title: Year

kenaz.description:
The rune Kenaz is represented by a flame or torch, reflecting the qualities of illumination, clarity, and the guiding light of truth. You are on the brink of a revelation; that which was hidden is now coming to light, revealing secrets and offering newfound understanding. This rune also represents the inner flame that lights your path, guiding you toward and helping you find your way through the darkness. Itâ€™s a beacon that encourages you to trust in your own light and to follow your intuition.

This rune is a powerful symbol of enlightenment and creativity. It speaks to the awakening of your inner wisdom, the spark of inspiration that fuels your creativity, and the regenerative energy that renews and transforms. You are aligned with your true purpose, and the universe is supporting you. Now is a time to seek out knowledge, explore new ideas, embrace your creativity and intellectual curiosity, and be open to learning and discovering new truths. This rune is a call to harness the energy of inspiration. Trust in your vision; the power of insight resides within you.
kenaz.reversal:
Your inner light may feel dim now; you may feel lost, lacking vision, or stuck in a creative rut. The clarity and inspiration that typically accompany this rune are blocked, leaving you grappling with false hope or instability. You may find it difficult to see your way forward, feeling disconnected from your true purpose or unsure of the path you should take. Your creativity feels stifled, your vision clouded, or your energy depleted.

Kenaz reversed suggests a need to reignite your inner flame, to find the spark that will guide you out of the darkness. Search for and realign with your true north.
kenaz.title: Torch

laguz.description:
Laguz represents the element of water; it is emotions, dreams, and intuition. This can be a time of emotional renewal and healing. Water has the power to cleanse and rejuvenate. It also symbolizes heightened imagination. Trust your intuitive insights and explore the depths of your emotions and inner world.

In a spiritual sense, Laguz embodies the mysteries and secrets of the unconscious mind. This can be a period of profound connection with the hidden aspects of yourself and the world around you. You are in tune with your inner guidance and are able to navigate the unknown with greater clarity and understanding.
laguz.reversal: Issues related to fear, misjudgment, or a disconnect from your spiritual self can be at the forefront now. You may struggle with emotional imbalance or difficulties in accessing your intuiton. Your inner voice can struggle to be heard and it can be difficult trusting your inner guidance now, leading to feelings of confusion or disconnection. Perhaps you are not fully engaging with your emotions.
laguz.title: Lake

mannaz.description:
Mannaz represents all of humankind; the essence of humanity, identity, and social order. There is a strong focus on how you relate with others and your role within the broader community. This rune highlights cooperation, mutual respect, and the importance of understanding and aligning with shared morals and values.

This rune embodies the concepts of social harmony and personal integrity. Stay true to your personal values and morals. Your sense of self and your interactions with others are in alignment with your core values and principles. Embrace your unique identity and work towards contributing to the well-being of your community.
mannaz.reversal: Self-delusion, manipulation, or isolation may be experienced now. Perhaps you are struggling with a distorted sense of self or facing challenges in your relationships with others. You may feel disconnected from your community or support network. Issues affecting your sense of identity and social interactions can be indicated now. You may also need to confront any issues of manipulation or isolation and to work towards finding genuine connection.
mannaz.title: Mankind

nauthiz.description:
Representing necessity, Nauthiz reflects the deeper aspects of what is necessary to achieve emotional stability and fulfillment. Reflect on your personal needs and whether you are effectively balancing work, play, and rest. Self-care and attention to your own health are crucial for maintaining well-being; we must first tend to ourselves before we can tend to others.

Explore areas where you may be feeling scarcity or restriction. Understanding these gaps can help you better build a more balanced life in the future. Remember to have patience during times of delay or hardship; know that they will end, and can also provide valuable lessons. Take the time to check in with yourself and assess whether you are giving yourself enough time and resources to recharge. Acknowledge any areas where you might be struggling or feeling restricted; some resourcefulness and resilience may be needed now to survive.
nauthiz.reversal:
You may be experiencing heightened feelings of scarcity or frustration, and your patience may be wearing thin. The reversal suggests that you might be facing significant obstacles or delays that are causing distress or making it difficult to meet your needs effectively.

All this may be potentially leading to burnout. It can indicate a tendency to overlook self-care or to be overly focused on external demands, neglecting the necessity of nurturing your own well-being.

Take a closer look at where you might be struggling with delays or restrictions. Ensure that you are not neglecting your own needs in the face of challenges. Remember; be patient, accept that recovery and making good choices takes time.
nauthiz.title: Needs

othala.description:
Othala, symbolizing inheritance, represents your lasting legacy, spiritual heritage, and the alignment of your values with what is truly important. This can be a time of recognizing and embracing the values and material resources that were passed down through generations. Communal prosperity is highlighed here, as is the importance of your cultural and spiritual inheritance. It can be especially rewarding to align your personal values with these deeper roots.

This can be a time to honor your heritage and to build upon the foundation laid by those before you. It reflects a strong connection to your lineage and the values that have shaped your identity. Appreciate and cultivate the legacy you are part of.

What is the significance of your inherited values? How dow they impact what you leave behind? How can you build that sense of continuity between past and future?
othala.reversal:
Not all things we inherit can be good for us. Prejudices and family trauma can also be carried over from past generations. You might be confronting these negative patterns now. Challenges related to your legacy or difficulties in aligning tradition with your core values can come to the forefront now.

A need to heal from generational issues is highlighed. There is always the possibility to break free from these patterns and shift them to be more closely aligned with your principles. This is how you build a legacy to leave behind that you can be proud of.
othala.title: Home

perthro.description:
Perthro is often associated with the cup of dice or the concept of fortune. It represents the element of chance and the unpredictability of life. It signifies that the influences affecting your situation may be due to luck or randomness. This rune highlights the ever-changing nature of circumstances and the need to adapt to the hand youâ€™ve been dealt. You are being invited to accept and work with the unpredictable elements in your life. You must now make the best out of unforeseen situations and to find value in the hidden or unknowable aspects of your path forward. Embrace the role of chance and change with an open mind, knowing that you have the power to influence your outcomes through your responses and attitudes.

Perthro is also the rune of hidden meanings, secrets, and the mysteries of life. It encourages you to embrace the uncertainties and to look for opportunities within them. Like the womb, the unknown carries the promise of new beginnings and the potential for growth through change. Make the most of whatever comes your way, whether it seems fortunate or challenging.
perthro.reversal:
You may be dealing with a loss of faith or a sense of disillusionment; and the chances have not been in your favor. Luck has not been on your side. Perhaps the chaos and randomness of life's events is causing frustration or anxiety. You may be struggling with accepting the uncertainties and changes that come your way, leading to a sense of defeat or hopelessness.

A reversed Perthro may also indicate difficulty finding meaning or hidden truths in your current circumstances. You may lack confidence in your ability to navigate the unknown. The mysteries of life seem to be working against you rather than for you.

What is the source of your feelings of doubt? Seek ways to rebuild your faith in the process of life. Reflect on how you can regain a sense of empowerment, even in the face of unpredictability.
perthro.title: Cauldron

raidho.description:
Raidho, the rune of the journey, is symbolized by the wheel, representing movement, progress, and the cycles of life. This rune signals a time of travel, whether thatâ€™s a physical journey such as a holiday, a relocation, or a deeper, more spiritual voyage that expands your horizons and personal growth. Symbolically, this rune embodies the concept of life as a journey, with each step forward offering new perspectives, lessons, and opportunities for evolution. It encourages you to embrace the natural rhythms and cycles of your path, trusting that each twist and turn brings you closer to where you are meant to be. Consider the broader journey you are onâ€”whether in your career, relationships, or personal life. It encourages you to put things into perspective, recognizing the cyclical nature of progress and the importance of each phase of your journey. To align with this rune, stay true to your path, embracing both the challenges and joys that come with the territory.

Raidho also speaks to aligning oneself with the flow of life, where timing and movement are crucial. You are in harmony with the greater order of the universe, and your journey is unfolding as it should. It is not just about reaching a destination, but also the experiences and growth you accumulate through it. Remember to be open to change, trust the process, and to keep moving forward with purpose and clarity.
raidho.reversal:
When Raidho appears reversed, it suggests a blockage or resistance in your journey, whether physical or spiritual. This could manifest as delays, obstacles, or an unwillingness to move forward, leaving you feeling stuck or uncertain about your direction. The smooth flow of progress is interrupted, and you may find yourself facing challenges that prevent you from continuing along your intended path.You may need to examine where you may be resisting change; perhaps indicating a fear of the unknown, reluctance to leave your comfort zone, or external circumstances that are hindering your movement.

Confronting whatever is causing the delay or resistance, will help you find the courage and determination to push through.
raidho.title: Wheel

sowilo.description:
Sowilo, represented by the sun, is a symbol of joy, abundance, and success, much like the sun that brings light and energy to the world. It is a time of positive energy, good fortune, and celebration. This rune reflects a period of achievement and optimal health, indicating that your goals are coming to fruition and that you are experiencing a surge of elemental power and vitality.

This rune represents the light and warmth of the sun, which offers clarity, illumination, and a sense of peace. You should take this time now to bask in the positivity and success that is currently surrounding you, and appreciate the blessings and little victories in your life. Enjoy the abundant opportunities that are unfolding for you. Good fortune often comes with this rune, so use this positive energy to continue pursuing your goals with enthusiasm and confidence. Let the sunâ€™s light guide you towards continued success.
sowilo.title: Sun

thurisaz.description:
Thurisaz embodies the raw, elemental power of the storm and the god Thor's hammer; an unstoppable force that can either protect or destroy, depending on how it is directed. It encourages you to wield this power with intention and awareness, recognizing that the energy you command has the potential to bring about significant change, both within and without. Remind yourself of your ability to stand firm in the face of adversity, using your inner strength to navigate the conflicts that arrive at your door and emerge stronger. Often associated with giants, this rune symbolizes the power of directed energy that you can yield as you wish, often in response to challenges or conflicts. You can harness the energy of this rune to defend what you hold dear, ward off threats, or break through obstacles that stand in your way. The runeâ€™s forceful nature also carries a cleansing, cathartic quality, suggesting that the conflicts or upheavals it heralds may serve a higher purpose, clearing away what no longer serves you to make way for new growth.

In a more contemporary sense, this rune urges you to embrace the full force of your convictions, stand your ground, and act with clarity and purpose even in the midst of turmoil. Itâ€™s a call to confront challenges and protect your boundaries. When aligned with this rune, you are reminded that true strength lies not just in physical power, but in the determination and courage to face whatever comes your way.
thurisaz.reversal:
You may be dealing with a loss of control or the misdirection of energy, leading to feelings of defenselessness, compulsion, or even betrayal. The protective power of Thorâ€™s hammer may feel distant, leaving you vulnerable or exposed to external threats. The power you once wielded with purpose may now be scattered, manifesting as spiteful actions, unresolved anger, or destructive tendencies that harm rather than heal.

Examine where your energy is being misused or where you may be overpowered by external forces. Take time for introspection and recalibration so that negative emotions or compulsive behaviors do not dictate your actions. You are being urged you to find a way back to a place of balance and self-empowerment.
thurisaz.title: Giant

tiwaz.description:
Tiwaz is symbolized by the warriorâ€™s arrowhead and associated with the god Tyr. It represents strength, leadership, and determination. You have the capability to navigate through challenges with authority and rationality. This rune highlights your leadership skills and your ability to spearhead projects or overcome obstacles with confidence and strategic thinking. Use your leadership qualities to take decisive action, assert your authority, tackle challenges with confidence, and recognize the victories that come from your dedication and self-discipline.

Tiwaz also embodies the principles of justice and honor. Victory and success is achieved through your own efforts and willingness to make sacrifices for the greater good. You must have the courage to stand by your principles, even in the face of adversity.
tiwaz.reversal:
You don't quite feel up for leadership these days, as you may find it difficult now to assert yourself and your beliefs. This may be because of a lack of passion or motivation. Without a strong sense of direction or vision, it is unclear what path you should be treading.

A reversed Tiwaz points to a need to address any internal conflicts or imbalances that are affecting your sense of purpose and drive. Your usual clarity and authority are challenged, leading to a sense of stagnation or frustration.
tiwaz.title: Tyr

uruz.description:
Uruz, the second rune of the Elder Futhark, embodies the raw, untamed energy of the wild bull, symbolizing primal strength, vitality, and the power of your inner will. This rune heralds a time of dynamic energy and robust health, where your physical and mental endurance are at their peak. This rune is a powerful reminder of your inherent capability to overcome challenges through sheer determination and hard work. It speaks to your ability to channel your inner strength into productive action, pushing through obstacles with persistence and unwavering focus.

Symbolically, Uruz represents the force of life itself, the driving energy that fuels growth and transformation. You are being called upon to embrace your full potential, tapping into the wellspring of power that resides within you. Uruz is also closely tied to the archetype of masculinity, not in terms of physical gender, but as a symbol of assertiveness, courage, and the ability to stand your ground. It calls on you to harness this energy in a balanced way, using your strength not just for self-advancement but for the betterment of those around you.

In a more practical sense, this rune urges you to recognize the power of perseverance and the importance of maintaining your health and vitality as you pursue your goals. True strength is not just physical but also lies in your ability to stay motivated and resilient, even in the face of adversity. When you align with the energy of Uruz, you have the capacity to shape your reality through focused effort, determination, and the unyielding belief in your ability to succeed.
uruz.reversal:
Reversed Uruz may serve as a warning of potential weakness or imbalance in your life. You may be dealing with a decline in physical health, a loss of motivation, or a sense of being overpowered by external forces. The vital energy that typically empowers you may feel blocked or misdirected, leading to frustration and a sense of stagnation.

You must now examine where your strength may be faltering and why. It may indicate that youâ€™re struggling with feelings of inadequacy or facing situations where your usual resilience is being tested. Now is a time to reassess how youâ€™re using your energyâ€”whether youâ€™re pushing too hard without rest, or allowing others to dictate your choices and way forward.

In essence, this rune is a call to reconnect with your strength and address any areas where your power feels diminished. By doing so, you can begin to restore balance, regain your vitality, and reassert control over your circumstances.
uruz.title: Ox

wunjo.description:
Wunjo embodies the essence of triumph, joy, and a sense of belonging. Now is a period of celebration, victory, and fulfillment. This rune reflects a time of harmony and prosperity, where you feel secure, connected, and aligned with your community or personal goals. It represents the joy of achieving a significant milestone and the comfort of being in a supportive environment.

Wunjo is a symbol of spiritual rewards and the positive outcomes that come from living in harmony with your values and surroundings.Take time to celebrate your successes and take pride in the life you've created. Remember to appreciate the support and joy you receive from your relationships and achievements. There is great value of celebrating your victories and cherishing the sense of belonging and safety that enriches your life.
wunjo.reversal:
Wunjo reversed can suggest a period of sorrow, alienation, or loss. The feelings of triumph and joy associated with this rune may be overshadowed by a sense of disconnection or dissatisfaction. It seems that your achievements are not bringing the fulfillment you had hoped for. You may need to address feelings of isolation or disappointment. You are struggling to find your place; a sense of belonging and support seems elusive now.

In essence, a reversed Wunjo is a call to confront and address the sources of sorrow or disconnection in your life. Search for new ways to find harmony and rebuild the sense of connection you may be lacking.
wunjo.title: Joy

wyrd.description:
This blank rune, sometimes referred to as Wyrd or the rune of Odin, represents the unknowable void. It symbolizes vast emptiness; the kind of emptiness from which everything has the possibility to occur. It often represents the idea that there are forces beyond our understanding at work. At its core is the duality of both possibility and uncertainty; where it is up to the seeker to take ownership of your future. Like a blank slate, life is continuously shaped by our choices and actions.

What you do now will clearly shape what is to come, and though that is true for most things, this rune is a strong signal that this affects you more than usual.

Odin, the most powerful of Norse gods, invites you to step into the unknown with faith and courage, whilst being assured that the path forward will be illuminated step by step. Wyrd is a symbol of both fate and personal responsibility, highlighting that the forces at play in our lives are often the culmination of our own decisions.
wyrd.title: Blank Rune

cards.label: Card Notes
cards.placeholder: What could this mean in the context of my question? Start typing...
cards.tip: Tip: Swipe this sheet up to reflect, swipe down to view card

newUser.title: Welcome!
toasts: What's this? ðŸ˜¯ Are you lost little one? It's been a long time since we had a spirit visit us here...
Oh me? ðŸ˜„ My name is Doppleganger, itâ€™s German for â€œDouble Walkerâ€. Iâ€™m an amorphous shadow that takes any form I want to! ðŸ˜‰

Hmm, well, thatâ€™s a little hard to explain. ðŸ˜® This is the space between realms, kind of like the place you go when you're dreaming. Itâ€™s a bridge between physical worlds. âœ¨ Everyone that comes here, whether theyâ€™re human, lizard, elf, goblin or whatever comes here in the same form - a specter, much like yourself. ðŸ‘» Sadly, itâ€™s been rather empty here lately.
Yes, I suppose that is a bit odd. The only spirits Iâ€™ve met that have ever forgotten were those that had lost the connection to their bodies, andâ€¦well, to their selves. ðŸ˜£
Well, you just need to astrally travel back to your body! Which may be a little difficult if you forgot where you left it... ðŸ¤”

Youâ€™re in luck! You're at Labyrinthos, âœ¨ðŸ”® which just happens to be where spirits like you can learn the art of tarot. And the tarot? It's really just a secret language of the self and the universe. Maybe learning that language can help! ðŸ¤©
I know it doesn't look like much, but back in the day we had many students, a whole staff of ðŸ monsters, ðŸ» beasts and ðŸŒ¸ gods that were truly focused on guiding students towards their true path.

YOUR DELICIOUS SOUL! ðŸ˜ˆ Just kidding. There hasnâ€™t been a monster that devours souls here in aeons. ðŸ˜…  Most things are free, but some fancy features do have monthly tuition costs. That keeps the headmistress's avatar from starving on the mortal plane.
Cool beans! ðŸ‘âœ¨ We're all set up! Off you go then! ðŸ‘‹

alerts: ðŸ“± I'd like the app to pull my cards for me!
ðŸ“– I'd like to draw cards from my physical deck and input them into the journal.
Yes, let me customize them! ðŸ‘€
ðŸ”” Nope, all sounds good!
I was just curious! ðŸ§
I'm in search of guidance about my life. â­ï¸
I'm seeking personal growth and transformation ðŸŒ±
I want to learn how to read tarot! ðŸ“š
Please auto-save my readings into my journal!

toasts: You find yourself in a mysterious world, bathed in a soft, ethereal glow. âœ¨The air is thick with magic and possibility. Your body feels light, almost as if you are floating. It's odd, but comfortable. ðŸ˜Œ
As you lift your eyes, you see that before you lies a tarot deck, shimmering with potential and beckoning you to approach. ðŸ”® Which deck is it?
What a lovely deck! ðŸ’– I'm sure it will be a faithful companion for you.
Now tell me, do you prefer the ease of digital readings? Or would you rather retain the tactile sensation of your physical decks and use this app as a reference? âœ¨

Tarot is a daily practice where each day is a chance to build your connection to the cards. A daily ritual also provides a safe space for reflection. Can I setup notifications for you at 8 am, or would you like to customize them? ðŸ””
And finally...out of curiosity dear Seeker, your soul arrived here on the astral plane with us for a reason. ðŸ’• Why do you think that is...?
Hmmm! An insightful answer. Thank you, Seeker. ðŸ™ You're now all set up. Happy reading!

alerts: From its heart...?
How did we forget?
What about you monsters?
But you're different, right?
So, you mean that you're my shadow?
sleeper.title: The Divine Being
toasts: Ahoy! Youâ€™ve been wandering the lands, I see. You must be curious about what this is. There is a legend that we monsters have been told since we were just wee ghosts. ðŸ¤”
Aeons ago, it was said that the astral plane was created by a divine being. ðŸ™Œ
This divine being was lonely, being in the void all by itself and all. It was sick of hearing its own echo.
To combat its loneliness, it crafted the material realm from a chunk of its own flesh, and fellow mortal spirits like you from its own heart. ðŸ’œ
Yeah! Sounds gross to me too! ðŸ˜£
But itâ€™s probably why you mortals and the divine being are so closely connected. You see, the divine being created you all from its core - meaning it depended on you.
Without your memories, your devotion and your love, it faded away. Now it sleeps, forgotten.

Well, funny thing - you were all created with a wonderful sense of curiosity, desire and imagination, a mirror of the divine being. Eventually you wandered too far, and werenâ€™t able to come back home! Itâ€™s not your fault really. Just kids being kids.
Oh us? As a last ditch attempt, the divine being summoned us with the remainder of the magic it had left. When we were awakened, the divine being was already asleep, but it left us a mission.
Written on a sacred post it note plastered on its forehead, was something something about getting you mortals back home.

It worked for a while; some of us monsters, gods and goddesses helped you hear the music of the stars that guided you back to the divine being. Sometimes we scared you, sometimes we inspired you, each in our own way. ðŸ’œ
But eventually you couldnâ€™t hear us either. ðŸ˜¢ Lots of us gave up. Most of us are sleeping now too.
Yep! Iâ€™ve been waiting for one particular mortal spirit. DoppelgÃ¤ngers are rather strange, you see - weâ€™re shadow spirits, meaning that weâ€™re assigned to one mortal each.
Thatâ€™s right! Spooky eh? ðŸ‘» We've been together for a long time. You and me, friend, weâ€™re going to go places.
But I canâ€™t help if youâ€™re not going to do your homework. So get cracking!

cards.description: What needs to be done to help you integrate these messages?

cards.description: What is in the process of fruition now, that I can nourish? What thing, inside or outside of me needs my care?

cards.description: What is in disarray? What things are running out of control right now? What things need structure, order and clarity?

cards.description: What do I have control over? Where do I have power to enact change?

cards.description: What things do I need to say â€œnoâ€ to? What things should I no longer accept in my life?

cards.description: What things bring me delight, joy and happiness? What needs safety? What do I need to keep safe at all costs?

cards.description: What stands in the way of love? What blocks you from receiving or giving love openly?

cards.description: What inner work has to still be done in order to open yourself to love more fully? Or what work has to be done in order to maintain love?

cards.description: How do you relate platonically? What is the state of your friendships?

cards.description: How do you relate to family? What are the common dynamics within your blood or chosen family?

cards.description: How do you relate to a romantic partner? If you have a partner, how would you describe your relationship? If youâ€™re single, how do you relate to the idea of a partner?

cards.description: How do you feel about commitment?

cards.description: How do you feel about dating? How do you flirt?

cards.description: When does your love go overboard? When have you caused harm with your love?

cards.description: How do you express selfless love? What do give to others freely without expecting anything in return?

cards.description: Where are you currently? What is the current state of your journey?

cards.description: Pulls you in one direction. What leads you away from your desired goal? What is distracting? What should you avoid because it doesnâ€™t bring you closer to where you want to be?

cards.description: What should your short term focus be? What is the next thing you should work on?

cards.description: What lies in your way? What needs to be overcome? What challenges do you face on this journey?
cards.name: Obstacle

cards.description: Where is all of this leading? What will your destination look like?

major7.description: A tarot spread for forging a path. Best used when you need help charting a way from where you are to where you want to be.

cards.description: How do you perceive yourself right now? What are some beliefs you have about yourself that are affecting this situation?

cards.description: What is the challenge the blocks your path? What do you need to overcome?

cards.description: What abilities do you have? What have you learned in your life that will aid you in overcoming your challenge?

cards.description: What talents or gifts were you bestowed with? What are your greatest blessings? What brings you luck?

cards.description: What knowledge does your higher self have about this situation? What does it know that can aid you?

cards.description: What else is within you that hasnâ€™t been acknowledged yet? Where does your greatest potential lie?

cards.description: What is the path before you? What needs illumination? What do you need to navigate that is obscured in darkness right now?

cards.description: What is your public persona? What mask do you present to others? Or, if this reading is focused on a particular problem - what do you believe you should do?
cards.name: Persona

cards.description: Who are you when youâ€™re alone? When there is nobody to make judgements, opinions or requirements of you, how are you when you just decide to be? Or if this reading is focused on a particular problem - what do you want to do?
cards.name: True Self

cards.description: What is your potential if you could embrace your true self? Or if this reading is about a problem - advice on navigating the problem.

major9.description: A tarot spread for the journey inward. Best used when you need some help separating your thoughts from those of others.

cards.description: What is your current state?
cards.name: Self

cards.description: What is the state of the world that surrounds you? How do they influence you and your choices?
cards.name: Environment

cards.description: This is a time of rest, of gathering energy. What are you taking a break from right now? What is awaiting renewal?
cards.name: Winter

cards.description: This is a time of growth. What in your life is just starting to come into fruition? What is gaining momentum?
cards.name: Spring

cards.description: This is a time of abundance, when everything is at its peak. What in your life is in full bloom right now? What can you appreciate, celebrate and be thankful for?
cards.name: Summer

cards.description: This is a time of loss, of passing and moving on. What in your life is leaving now? What things are no longer needed?
cards.name: Fall

major10.description: A tarot spread for moving with the cycles. Best used when you need to look the events of your life from a wider perspective.

cards.description: What is your desired outcome? What do you want out of this?

cards.description: What is their desired outcome? What do they want out of this?
cards.name: Their Needs

cards.description: What is there to be gained if I do what I want? What are some positive results?

cards.description: What are some possible negative results of doing what I want? How do I inadvertently harm?

cards.description: What is there to be gained if I do what they want? What are some positive results?

cards.description: What are some possible negative results of doing what they want? How do I inadvertently harm?

cards.description: How do I find a middle path? What does the middle path look like?

cards.description: Where can I put more effort? How can I best use my energy? What is the most beneficial use of my energy?

cards.description: What can I let go of? Where in my life is it better for me to step aside?

major11.description: A tarot spread for weighing decisions and actions. Best used when you are trying balance the needs of yourself and others for the best possible outcome.

cards.description: What viewpoint is challenging you right now? What is the conflict about?

cards.description: What feelings does this viewpoint create for you?

cards.description: Where is the source of these feelings? What are you taking personally? Where does it come from?

cards.description: What do you need to let go of? What is preventing you from accepting a different perspective?

cards.description: If you learn to put your defensiveness behind, what message awaits you when you do?

major12.description: A tarot spread for accepting differences. Best used when you need help seeing something from another personâ€™s point of view.

cards.description: What is being lost? What is the process of ending, and cannot be changed, slowed down or altered?

cards.description: Who were you before this loss? Who are no longer?

cards.description: Who do you have the chance to be once this change is complete?

cards.description: What lessons does this loss have for you? What do you know now that you didnâ€™t before? Or what memories should be cherished?

cards.description: What still needs to be let go? What are you still holding on to that is no longer realistic?

cards.description: How can you move on? How can you rest and recover?

major13.description: A tarot spread for coping with loss or change. Best used when you need help processing a difficult transition.

cards.description: Something to add to the cauldron. What do you want to transform?

cards.description: Something to add to the cauldron. What do you want to transform?

cards.description: Something to add to the cauldron. What do you want to transform?

cards.description: The first step of alchemy. What needs to be broken down into its parts? What needs to be confronted?

cards.description: Who is the person that you think of yourself as? What identity are you most interested in preserving?

cards.description: A thing, attitude, feeling or belief that no longer serves you.

cards.description: A thing, attitude, feeling or belief that no longer serves you.

cards.description: What is my fondest desire? What do I dream of? What do I aspire to after this period?

cards.description: A friendly companion. What can aid you in finding clarity?

cards.description: What is the state of your body? How are you feeling?

new-moon.description: When the moon is invisible, it signals that all has been cleared, and itâ€™s time to have a new beginning. Itâ€™s thought of as a good time to gather ideas, thoughts and plan ahead for the coming month or so. It is also here where we will begin a new cycle. Here, we will ask you about what you would like to accomplish this cycle, and why.
new-moon.title: New Moon

wane-cres.description: This is a time for recuperation. To be fully open to the next cycle, one must completely be relieved from this one. Try and clear your mind, wrap up all loose ends, and prepare for the next cycle of rebirth and regeneration.
wane-cres.title: Waning Crescent

wane-gibb.description: While your actions and their reactions are still clear in your memory, itâ€™s a good time to reflect. This stage, like its waxing mirror, is also one for refining, but this time, instead of looking at what we've done, look inward this time. Think about how you feel, your thought processes, and your assumptions, your perception of yourself - how has that impacted your actions?
wane-gibb.title: Waning Gibbous

cards.description: What parts of yourself will be called upon to make your intentions manifest? What can you give to this situation?

cards.description: What is the sum of all these influences? How will these come together?

wax-cres.description: Think about this time as planting a seed. The new moon gave you a chance to think about what it is that you want to accomplish, but the waxing crescent asks us to make it known, and develop our willpower to push it into fruition. Today, we will go over and develop a clearer picture of what that could look like, and plan your path to it.
wax-cres.title: Waxing Crescent

cards.description: What blocks you from the completion of your intention? What is there left to solve?

cards.description: What did initially think would be the outcome of undertaking your intention?

cards.description: How is your quest actually coming along? What is the current status of your manifestation?

cards.description: What aspect of yourself makes it the most difficult for you to overcome the current status quo?

cards.description: What aspect of yourself gives you the strength to overcome the current status quo and complete your intention?

wax-gibb.description: The waxing gibbous moon is there when we are close to our goals, but we need to assess their viability. Perhaps your original desire is not possible at this time, but a different version of it is. We'll analyze any of the missteps that might have been taken, and consider what we can improve. Perhaps by changing the details, you can come closer to your goal.
wax-gibb.title: Waxing Gibbous

cups-38.png.description: The Princess of Chalices contains both earth and water elements. They are neutral towards each other, meaning that she doesnâ€™t have many internal conflicts. Her watery nature gives her great depths of feeling and sensitivity, perhaps too much even. She may find herself easily lost within the realms of her own fantasies. Despite the element of earth within her, she can be rather impractical, but also talented in manifesting her emotions and channeling them into artistic endeavors. It is through art where her earth element is more visible. She has a gentle and kind personality. Because she lacks the elements of fire and air, she can be irrational and naive.
cups-38.png.title: Princess of Chalices

cups-39.png.description: The element of air gives the Prince of Chalices intelligence, while water gives him depth and emotion. These two elements are neutral to each other, creating no inherent contradictions to his character. However, air and water can come together to create intense storms, and this is further supported by the zodiac sign Scorpio. The combination of his elements can mean that he has a talent for philosophy as well as the arts. Scorpio gives him a tendency to bury and protect his greatest passions. It may be difficult for him to open up emotionally.
cups-39.png.title: Prince of Chalices

cups-40.png.description: Because the Queen of Chalices is constitutes the element of water twice, she represents the purest expression of the elementâ€™s nature. She is the symbol for pure emotion; her love is boundless and she gives her compassion and care to all. Her sensitivity means that she is able to understand and connect with others deeply, empathizing with what is at the core of their souls. However, because she lacks earth and its stability, and the active inspiration of fire, and the logic of air, her passivity means that she oftentimes finds herself floating in the realm of her own feelings. Her emotions come and go, meaning she can be unreliable.
cups-40.png.title: Queen of Chalices

cups-41.png.description: Because of the opposing forces of fire and water, the character of the Knight of Chalices may be rather unstable as he tries to balance out the different aspects of his personality. This combination gives him a kind of charm. He may be talented in artistic endeavors with the help of water. Fire gives him swiftness, and a jolt of energy and inspiration. His moods are fickle, he can be easily excited, but also easily bored. His contradictions mean that his attempts at taking action are hasty, and can mean mistakes that lead him to trouble. We see this reflected in his astrological correspondences as well: Aquarius speaks to his humanitarian nature, as well as his tendency to be rather flighty when it comes to the realm of emotions. Pisces speaks to his spirituality and depth.
cups-41.png.title: Knight of Chalices

cups-42.png.description: The Ace of Chalices is the ruler of water, embodying our emotions and our sense of creativity. From this Chalice flows an infinite love; it flows ceaselessly and unconditionally. It is through the Chalices that we can experience the first stirrings of love, camaraderie, friendship and the foundation for all relationships. While the wands can be thought of as an active, masculine element, the Chalices are considered its receptive, feminine counterpart. Thus this card represents the source and potential for new stirrings of feeling within oneâ€™s soul. It may start as a bit of sympathy or understanding between two people, or a newfound passion for a project. With a little nurturing and effort, these feelings can blossom into something that is truly beautiful.
cups-42.png.title: Ace of Chalices

cups-43.png.description: In the Two of Chalices, the universal, boundless love from the Ace of Chalices has been channeled into love for a single individual or object of affection. This card represents a partnership. This partnership does not necessarily have to be romantic - it can be a professional relationship or a deep friendship. It suggests a unity of opposites, one that is balanced and equal, even if they are very different. There are shared principles, goals and respect between these two that can help these individuals find happiness.
cups-43.png.title: II of Chalices

cups-44.png.description: With the Three of Chalices, the love for one has transformed into a love for many. This card gives us a sense of enjoyment and belonging that comes from feeling loved and nurtured by your community. With this card also comes the feeling of gratefulness; there are no needs that are wanting. Regardless of what material possessions you have, there is a firmly rooted knowledge that you have everything that you need to be happy within yourself and the people that surround you and appreciate your company.
cups-44.png.title: III of Chalices

cups-45.png.description: When transitioning from the Three of Chalices to the Four, the emotions gain a kind of stability. There is comfort here, but in that comfort, things also become fixed. Now that the passion has waned, and you have already conquered what you felt was our biggest goal, you may now be taking the joy that is in your life for granted. While stability may be powerful for some suits, it is not so with the suit of Chalices, which represents water. In order for water to be fresh and clear, it needs to keep flowing. A stagnant pool will eventually grow foul.
cups-45.png.title: IV of Chalices

cups-46.png.description: When the Four of Chalicesâ€™ apathy develops further, it becomes the Five of Chalices. Geburah is the sephirah of destruction, and the changes that arise from that destruction. Applied to the suit of Chalices, it implies suffering in the emotional world. You may be feeling disappointed that what you had wanted to achieve did not turn out as you had planned. Only 2 of the cups are upside down and empty, meaning that not all is lost. You may find it hard to see the 3 remaining cups that are still there for you to pick up. You still have the chance to move on towards something better, should you not allow yourself to be overcome by grief and fear. Donâ€™t let one disappointment dissuade you from taking on new challenges.
cups-46.png.title: V of Chalices

cups-47.png.description: After the suffering of the Five of Chalices, we once again find balance and peace at the Six of Chalices. It is from overcoming suffering that we learn to love anew again, but with greater awareness and consciousness. We are filled with a deeper appreciation for that love, after experiencing the pain of despair. This card is also indicative of healing; finding comfort during this time is so much more important to you. Allow yourself to enjoy the pleasures of life, for it can help mend the wounds you carry with you.
cups-47.png.title: VI of Chalices

cups-48.png.description: The Seven of Chalices arises out of the Six of Chaliceâ€™s need for pleasure going to extremes. While it is only natural for us to search for new, pleasurable experiences, we can run into danger if we allow that desire to run unchecked. We may be dealing with addictive patterns that are never quite enough to satiate you; you may find yourself indulging in the senses with food, sex, material possessions or drugs. These are temporary pleasures that may fill up a void, but the void is ever-hungry, and requires more and more from you to feel full. You are being called forth to reclaim your self-control; if you can allow yourself the experience of these pleasures without addiction to them, you can use them for a higher good.
cups-48.png.title: VII of Chalices

cups-49.png.description: In the Eight of Chalices, the waters of inspiration have dried up; we no longer find any interest in our relationships with others, or our personal projects. While in the previous card we overindulged in all the pleasures of life in order to feed a beast that could never be satiated, here we find absolutely zero joy in pleasure. The beast is not just satiated, it is ready to retch. Our senses are dulled, what was once an addiction is no longer appealing after we have indulged so much. There is numbness, and emptiness in this card. You may be searching, wandering aimlessly, looking for something that creates a spark in your emotions again.
cups-49.png.title: VIII of Chalices

cups-50.png.description: After a long journey, the Nine of Chalices symbolizes the finding of satisfaction. The emotional journey of the Chalices returns to a balanced center after the volatile extremes of the Seven and Eight of Chalices. You have indulged all your desires to their fullest, and have traversed an arid desert of emptiness to get to the moment where you are now. What you have attained here is trust in what the universe provides you, and a feeling that what happens is meant to happen; things are as they should be. This card is also sometimes known as the wish card, your dreams becoming manifest.
cups-50.png.title: IX of Chalices

cups-51.png.description: When we feel loved, we naturally emanate love to those that surround us. That is the true gift of the Ten of Chalices; a joy that doesnâ€™t just remain isolated within us, but radiates throughout us and into others. Loving is easy now. There is a deep gratitude for all that life has given to you, and so you repay the world in turn with generosity, compassion and kindness.
cups-51.png.title: X of Chalices

major-02.png.description: The Fool represents the spirit descended into matter, creating the universe. It is a symbol of the infinite potential that lies within all of us. The Fool is truly innocent, full of promise and freedom, and the pure joy of feeling at one with the universe. The number 0, shaped like an egg, further reinforces the Foolâ€™s ability to take any and all directions. All possibilities are open to him. He represents the start of something, unbound by the past, and having the freedom to explore a boundless future. He does not consider consequences, and doesnâ€™t plan ahead but rather only reacts to what the world brings him. He follows his instincts, like an animal, in step with the natural world. With this animalistic bravery, he also is filled with optimism and belief in his own abilities, fearless and courageous.
major-02.png.title: The Fool

major-03.png.description: If the Fool represents potential, the Magus represents the molding of that potential and giving it direction. He represents taking conscious action, and turning an idea into reality. Instead of reacting, like the Fool, the Magus chooses to act. He represents deliberate action, as well as the consequences of these actions. He is surrounded by all the tools that are necessary for him to succeed at the endeavors that he chooses. He will have to however, think carefully about exactly what he chooses, for not all things will be helpful for his progress and his growth. This card is also about taking the first step towards conscious development, even if that brings you out of the innocence of the Fool. His approach is organized and thoughtful. He has close associations with Mercury.
major-03.png.title: The Magus

major-04.png.description: From the creation of experiences useful for our spiritual journey, the Magus can now proceed to developing a deeper connection with the inner self, embodied as the Priestess. She guards the path that leads to an eventual union with a higher truth. As we move towards her in an attempt to reach the spirit, represented by the rainbow behind her, we must first go beyond the illusions of the material world, embodied by the beauty of nature at her feet. She is partially hidden under a veil, representing logical thought, and our tendency to categorize and give words to things that exist beyond language. Finally, the night that is the backdrop for this card represents our feelings and emotions, sometimes which can lead us towards truth, but can also mask itself as higher intuition, leading some people astray into false spiritual practices instead of towards the self.
major-04.png.title: The Priestess

major-05.png.description: When we connect with our inner selves through the Priestess, we can now begin to see and interact with the world through the lens of that new spiritual knowledge. When we learn that the true nature of the universe is one that is loving, nurturing, and full of kindness, we can also make the choice to live in alignment and harmony with that nature by expressing our love in return. Our external lives tend to take precedence over what our souls and our spirits need. The Empress represents the moment where we make the choice express our spiritual lessons by showing love over fear and mercy over conflict. It is through the Empress that the world is redeemed, and we can rediscover beauty in all things. Represented by the rainbow, her love is endless, and stretches across all things. She is also known as the divine feminine, mother nature and Venus.
major-05.png.title: The Empress

major-06.png.description: From the great love of the Empress, we now transition to learning the value of responsibility. Here is where the Emperor excels. While he understands love, he also understands that it sometimes requires a firmer touch. In order to tread further upon the spiritual path, sometimes control, order and structure is needed. His power also represents stability and security; when treading the spiritual path, discipline and routine is also necessary. Rational thought, separated from the emotional self may bring you to where you need to go. You may find yourself in a moment where these traits are helpful to further your progress. He is the divine masculine and the law of civilization, and is associated with the planet Mars.
major-06.png.title: The Emperor

major-07.png.description: After the Emperor learns to organize and structure his experiences on the spiritual path, he then turns to the hierophant, who seeks to teach him the ways of applying what he has learned to his practical life. The Hierophant represents the translation of our spiritual world into a practice. This can be through self-study, meeting with others that share your beliefs, choosing a spiritual mentor, or anything else that brings you towards a closer connection with your path.  Compared to the Priestess, the Hierophant is concerned with our external spiritual lives, while she is concerned with a more direct connection through experience.
major-07.png.title: The Hierophant

major-08.png.description: On one hand, this card stands for shared love; one that represents the union of opposites and is the wellspring of creation. On the other hand, it also represents a commitment or a choice, one that is major and marks the beginning of a new way of life. This choice sets you on a path, one that you must be committed to regardless of circumstances. Going on this path, can also be one to eliminate others - it is one that is mutually exclusive. This does not have to apply to love, but it can also apply to a commitment one makes to a career, a project or another desire. Spiritually, this card represents the Foolâ€™s task to now make the correct choices for oneâ€™s spiritual journey.
major-08.png.title: The Lovers

major-09.png.description: Once we have made our commitment to our path, we can shoot forward with speed and conviction. This is what the Chariot represents. Armored, like the crab at the charioteerâ€™s head, you can progress (rather forcefully) through any roadblocks that stand in your way. The chariot moves in a single direction, blind, but always moving forward. The creatures, representing the fixed zodiac signs, are all of differing natures, implying inherent conflict. But all are kept in check with the careful control asserted by the charioteer. The conflicts between the driving forces of this chariot are not however, resolved. Careful consideration is needed. While you make firm steps forward, think carefully about whether the paths you make are in alignment with your true self.
major-09.png.title: The Chariot

major-10.png.description: Known as Strength in the Rider-Waite-Smith tradition, this cardâ€™s name is altered to Lust in order to better illustrate the relationship between the beast and the higher self.  It is not a relationship of dominance and repression, but rather one of conscious understanding and acceptance. All of us contain an instinctual animalistic nature; it is dangerous to ignore it as well as to let it escape. It is only through acceptance of our natural instincts that we can unlock and benefit from their power. Lust is considered the first card in the second half of the Major Arcana, where oneâ€™s journey into the depths of the self begins. This jump towards the depths starts with the pursuit of our passions, even if they are not typically thought of as spiritual in nature. All things, when looked at from the perspective of true passion, can be spiritual in nature.
major-10.png.title: Lust

major-11.png.description: At times, in order to realign ourselves with our ultimate purpose and true self, as we would do in the Adjustment card, we need to take a step back and spend some time in solitude with only our own voice. This is not a retreat that comes from defeat, but one that comes from love and self care. The loudness of the world can sometimes threaten to overtake the oftentimes quiet voice of the inner self. And sometimes, only in stillness, can we hear that voice. The Hermit walks a path that leads him back to himself, and thus that path is solitary. Be conscious of your travels here; if this retreat turns into the fear of the world and others, the solitary path can become lonely and isolating. Remind yourself that this inward path is all in search of a larger goal.
major-11.png.title: The Hermit

major-12.png.description: Fortune is a wheel that we have no control over; it ebbs and flows, exalts some, and crushes others. Our life is full of external circumstances, some of which we have no power to change. Though we try our hardest to hold on to the events that bring us good luck, there are forces that are beyond human control. These are the same forces that create the seasons, that make the sun rise and fall, the moon to shift between her phases. Fortune teaches us to find our center, regardless of where the wheel turns for us. This is the test the Hermit prepares us for; wherever the wheel turns, if we find our true center, the place of stillness in the perpetual rotation of fate, we can take any motion that life brings our way. When the worldâ€™s circumstances are turned upside down, we can remain strong.
major-12.png.title: Fortune

major-13.png.description: As the charioteer moves with speed towards his path, one of the most important requirements of her movement forward is learning to adjust and balance her movements. This applies not to just the forces that are within her, but to the path that she takes. While the Chariot moves blindly, the next step in the journey of the Fool is to learn how to see. This card encourages us to take an objective view of the situation; to learn more about how our actions illicit change in our world and in ourselves. If those changes are aligned with our purpose, continue. If they are not, what can we adjust to within ourselves to realign again?
major-13.png.title: Adjustment

major-14.png.description: The Hanged Man represents a turning point; from his perspective everything looks different. This card represents a shift in ones viewpoint that brings a whole different understanding of the world. Even though he does not seem to be in control, it must be understood that he is in this position out of his own choice. He is suspended, and in this position, no action can be done. Instead, he contemplates, in waiting, to accept what the universe gives to him. There is stillness in this card, and lots of waiting. But the emptiness allows the hanged man to change his understanding of the world. He dives headfirst into the depths, which threaten to swallow him whole. Though one would normally be afraid, he has no fear, for he understands that what the universe gives him is infinitely loving.
major-14.png.title: The Hanged Man

major-15.png.description: Death, though menacing, can also be a transformation  and the ending of one thing that also brings about the birth of another. It is the endless cycle of life and a reminder that change is the law that binds all things. To have life, one must have death; and in this way, things are made beautiful by their fleeting nature. The ending of something is bound to be painful; this card does not imply that transformation is without suffering. But regardless of oneâ€™s feelings or attachments, all things must come to an end, and we must learn to let go. The refusal to let go is what creates the deepest pain. Instead of holding on to something that is decaying, we must remember that what dies also gives us the materials for new life. If we can feel the pain, and honor it, but ultimately also leave it behind, it can bring forth more beauty. To stay with something we outgrow only leads to decay and stagnation.
major-15.png.title: Death

major-16.png.description: Art here also represents the art of alchemy, a metaphorical process by which the soul is transformed into greater union with the universe. What to the outside world was perceived as the transformation of lead into gold, those that understood its complex symbolism knew that it was also a way of describing the path towards self-actualization. The process of alchemy, in short, involves taking materials, purifying them, and re-creating them anew. The reappearance of the divine masculine and feminine as represented in the Emperor and Empress signal once again the union of opposites, but this time, they are purified, parts of a more perfect whole. By meeting Death and cutting away of all those things that no longer serve him, the Fool is now purified and can create something of even more immense beauty.
major-16.png.title: Art

major-17.png.description: The Devil symbolizes our shadow selves, those aspects that we perceive as negative, and have chosen to ignore, repress, or project onto others. In order to continue on our spiritual path, we must learn to integrate this shadow self. We detest others who remind us of our own shame. If we can learn to be more accepting of our own faults, we can also be more accepting of others. This is the darker side of the Devil, where our own self-hatred entraps us and obstructs us from a deeper connection with other living beings. On the other hand, our conception of the Devil was derived from Pan, the god of wine and music, whose enjoyment of the pleasures of nature became demonized. This card can also symbolize playfulness and the enjoyment of the world, without judgment, without rules. It is the card of independence and free will.
major-17.png.title: The Devil

major-18.png.description: There are certain things in life that we have learned to rely on, and sometimes even take for granted, that when they finally break down, can create suffering, turmoil and immense fear. The Tower refers to the sudden and tumultuous breakdown of these foundational structures, from which we build the our lives upon. When these moments happen, we may feel as though nothing will ever be the same. Our feelings of security have all but vanished, we feel as though anything and everything can be torn from us at any moment. Nothing feels safe. Although these moments are painful, sometimes we need to lose everything in order to finally see our own strength. The Tower card, through stripping us of everything we hold dear, shows us that we can still persevere; that we are resilient, that we need nothing but ourselves and the light that lives within all of us.
major-18.png.title: The Tower

major-19.png.description: From the immense loss of the Tower, the Fool has learned resilience, and is given the inspiration of the Star. This card represents hope in its purest form, like a single sprout shooting out from the rubble of a burnt city. When the Fool has nothing but the light of his own spirit, he realizes that he has everything that he needs within himself. It represents the hope of gazing at the vast night sky and making a wish. It represents faith when we are surrounded by darkness and choose to follow a starâ€™s guiding light, trusting that it will lead us out and to our destination. The Fool trusts that the path that he has taken, even with all its pain and suffering, has been the right one. The Fool is also learning that he no longer has to hold onto beliefs, attitudes or feelings that he considers his identity, and instead can just feel them, without attachment.
major-19.png.title: The Star

major-20.png.description: The Moon represents the Foolâ€™s journey into the night, the darkest part of the unconscious. This unconscious is filled with traumas, anxieties, denials, hidden desires and repressed memories. It is the confrontation we have with our own mirror. In this card, the Fool takes the form of a scarab beetle, descending and then arising from the depths with the light of the sun. He must travel through the space between two combative parts of his own personality, represented by the two howling wolves that perch upon the pillars. From the darkness, he illuminates all that remains hidden in the night, and brings them to the surface. Under the light, all those dark secrets suddenly become much less fearful than we imagined.
major-20.png.title: The Moon

major-21.png.description: As the Fool brings his fears and into the light, he discovers more confidence and trust in himself. This is represented by the Sun card. The Sun is the source of all life on earth; and it shines it light without expectation of reward. It is generous, it always gives its energy without fearing that it makes itself weaker or lesser.
